Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel. Great location. Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: Bill G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on a recent vacation to San Francisco. It is a great place : beautiful , spacious room. Great bed. It's really more of an apartment than a hotel room. Full kitchen with appliances. Wonderful rooftop deck. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gstonian
Reviews.Content: Spacious, clean rooms with self catering options make this a great place to stay. Rooms smelled a little upon entering but a quick blast of the fans sorted that out and wasn't an issue Overall, a great option for staying in San Francisco with an excellent location and also a very comfy bed.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect family hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Walkinggranny
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was all suites so that the children could sleep in the sitting room of our bedroom, rather than take a chance on interconnecting rooms in a conventional hotel. That was exactly what happened but also the hotel was so much more! We loved this small hotel in so many ways and I would recommend it to anyone travelling with young children. The posiiton was perfect, an easy walk to the piers to see all the sights, and surrounded by great restaurants. The bedroom was spacious, the sitting room even bigger. There was plenty of room for the sofa bed and a rollaway bed too, for the children. Having a kitchen was wonderful for jet lagged children in the middle of the night or very early morning, a bowl of cereal or a hot drink for us, brilliant! The staff were all so sweet, really helpful and child friendly. The roof terrace was stunning, with a fabulous view across the bay to Alcatraz, the GG bridge and more..... a wonderful place for afternoon tea after a hard day's touring. Even better, the sushi and noodles from Grandeho Kamyeko, a few doors away, was the perfect takeaway dinner to feed to tired children, before they went to sleep while we enjoyed a bottle of wine. A perfect base. This is the place to stay with kids in SF, good value and really friendly!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, great value and masses of space”
Reviews.Author: HappyFamily0f3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bed suite on the first floor for five nights in April. This really was a fully equipped apartment, with plenty of space for a family to live in. The cable car stop was right outside our window and it was quite loud but the cable cars are part of San Francisco’s charm, so we enjoyed watching them come and go from our sitting room as well as riding on them. It’s a very easy walk from the hotel down to the waterfront and restaurants. Don’t miss Hyde Pier and its historic boats at end of Hyde Street – this was a hidden highlight, just on the hotel’s doorstep. There is a laundrette on the next corner up the hill and supermarkets nearby, so this is a great location all-round, especially with a family.

Reviews.Title: “Now that's service!”
Reviews.Author: PamelaJ47
Reviews.Content: After leaving my pillow behind, the staff responded to my request to post it to my next destination NYC. Thank you received in a timely way. Apart from the excellent location and roomy suites this kind of service is very much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable space in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Gwen88
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling with your family and/or want to store and prepare your own food, this is the perfect property at a great price. The staff goes out of their way to welcome you and make you comfortable. Although our room faced an interior courtyard, it was perfectly quiet as the rest of the guests must have been considerate to not talk outside the rooms at night. There were two TVs and lots of kitchen equipment. My only complaint is that I couldn't get the bedroom very dark as the courtyard light was on full all night and the curtain stood away from the window located right over the bed. Even so, I would definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, impeccable service, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellerBC
Reviews.Content: Just checked-out after a 4day stay - the suite was large and had a pullout bed in the living room and a great Queen sized bed in the separate bedroom. Bathroom was basic but clean and amenities provided - the FULL kitchen, microwave, blender, dishwasher were a bonus - especially if you needed to save money by cooking or making your own breakfasts. The location at the corner of Hyde and North Point is at the crossroads of both the Powell-Hyde cablecare or the MUNI bus which will take you directly downtown. Of course you will spend most of your day exploring Fisherman's Wharf - 2 blocks awayfrom the main strip. The staff are excellent - helpful and always cheery. Parking is tight if you have a car - small spaces and ther SUVs take up most of the spots. Free WiFi - bonus. Great roof deck to read and have a view. Highly recommended - only issue : noise from the roads nearby - you can hear the cablecars and buses - so if you are a light sleeper the suites will not do.

Reviews.Title: “Location and room”
Reviews.Author: soupysales_11
Reviews.Content: We were only in the San Fran area for 24 hours, but I'd recommend this place for an extended stay because our room had a kitchen! Parking onsite was available ($20/day). And it was located one block from the Ghirradelli Square activities! Didn't look like much from the outside, but our 1 bedroom King suite was very, very nice, clean, and roomy! Free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed with with the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf, San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl45992
Reviews.Content: We were presently surprised with our stay over the New Year's holiday. The resort was huge for San Francisco and was so close to the attractions. We loved the staff as they were so accomodating and went out of their way to make our stay comfortable!!! We would highly recommend this resort and already have plans to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “fishermans wharf a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pickles406
Reviews.Content: we stayed at fishermans wharf september 6th thru the 12th for our anniversary. our lodging was very quaint. a one bedroom, we usually had breakfast in our room, and lunch as well as supper out. we rented a car, but for most of our stay it wasnt needed. most everthing was in walking distance. the staff at the wharf was by far the best, they all went out of their way to take care of the guests. we attended a 49ers game, not wanting to drive. we were given the location of where the bus would pick us up for the game and where we would be dropped of after the game. all in walking distance. if there was one problem it would be parking, which was very limited. there was are parking garage with very little space. be sure you let them know as soon as possible that you have a car. again you cant go wrong staying at the wharf

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay right next to prime spots in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon0219
Reviews.Content: Our room came with a full kitchen and huge living room. You can go on top of the roof and see views of alcatraz!!We loved how close we were to fisherman's wharf, ghiradelli square and the cable car stops. The suites is located at such a prime spot in San Francisco! We will definitely be back here soon!

Reviews.Title: “Suite-Heart Of A Place Has It All”
Reviews.Author: cecilafayette
Reviews.Content: Year after year we come back to SFW because we love it so much! SFW is truly a place with everything, starting with location, location, location. It is steps from Ghirardelli Square and just a short walk to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. The Cable Car and bus lines stop in front of SFW which makes traveling to Chinatown and Union Square very easy and fun. The Suites themselves have a spacious living room with a t.v. and dvd player, and a full kitchen including dishes, pots and pans, and a microwave. The rooftop terrace has a fantastic view of SF and the ocean. There is a mom n pop grocer a block away, and a full supermarket a few blocks in the other direction. Which brings me to the FABULOUS staff! Everyone at the SFW is VERY kind, friendly, and HELPFUL!! They are there with maps and directions and helpful tips, and they are just so NICE. . SFW has an excellent location, very nice facility, and super staff. When you step out the front door the view of the ocean greets you as you start your day....

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Roomy , Affordable”
Reviews.Author: happytravels2011di
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean . The view from rooftop was great .. Cable car convenient, Short walk to bus transportation. Very kind helpful employees. The kitchen well stocked . Just needed scissors and teapot. Otherwise had everything else. Jason at front desk was super nice and helpful to everyone. Short walk to fishermans wharfe . Close to china town and Italian area. We would definitely come back. We have already recommended this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Susanne V
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my family for 5 days and the stay was absolutely perfect. It is properly the place with the best value in SF. The rooms are big and very clean. The hotel has a very good location. The staff are very nice and service minded. We would for sure come back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value, great comfort”
Reviews.Author: jetlagPrincetonNJ
Reviews.Content: Our inside suite (106) was spacious and immaculate, with a convenient additional pull-out sofa bed and well equipped kitchen. One one side It shares, with adjacent units, a common balcony with a very narrow view of the sky; on the other side is an indoor atrium with limited light. Result is a rather dark suite that could have used somewhat brighter interior lighting, but is also very quiet and cozy. All in all, a terrific choice and great value. Extremely helpful and friendly staff. Highly recommended. This is a real find. We'd gladly check in again the next time in SFO.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very spaciuos suites”
Reviews.Author: DorsetKezzer
Reviews.Content: Three out of five doesn't quite do this place justice, its above 'average' but not quite 'very good'. On the positive side, it has a great location with Cable car stop right outside and Fisherman's wharf just a couple of blocks away. The apartment is big with a well equipt kitchen and the staff are very helpful. While we were staying they had some problems with the boiler and the staff were excellent at keeping us up to date. On the down side, the bedroom was a bit noisy from comings and goings in the atrium, the bed linen wasn't good, nylon type sheets which felt horrible, the cleaning wasn't brill, few black hairs found which defintely didn't belong to us, and in general it wont be too far away until the suite does need a good refurb. Having said all that I guess it depends what the most important thing is to you when choosing your hotel. We would certainly stay here again because of the value, (you get a whole suite for the cost of a room elsewhere) and the location.

Reviews.Title: “I probably should not even be talking about it...”
Reviews.Author: PRMimi
Reviews.Content: This is one of San Francisco's best kept secrets! It felt like home, only in the heart if Fisherman's Wharf with a magnificent view from our balcony. Our suite was HUGE! Very clean. Yes, it's a little noisy (cable car stop right in front of the hotel), but on the upside, no need for a car. The rooftop terrace offers spectacular views (especially by night) of the Golden Gate bridge and the city. We had a ball. Highly recommend the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf:)

Reviews.Title: “Best value in San Fran!”
Reviews.Author: Coastrealtor
Reviews.Content: We will absolutely be staying here again! Fantastic value for the price. Great service, great location and large, spacious suites. I highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smokybear_13
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location! It was our anniversary and everyone went out of their way to make us feel welcome. They have a great rooftop area for watching the city lights at night and then also for drinking your coffee in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Small Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirl234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Suites at Fisherman’s Wharf for 5 nights in January. The price was reasonable and the location was perfect for sightseeing. The staff was very accommodating and the hotel was spotless. We would definitely stay here again. The only downside for us was that the internet connectivity was spotty. If you are looking for a 5 star luxury hotel, this is definitely not the place for you. If you like having a suite complete with living room and kitchenette in a great location at a moderate price, book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location and Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Alison B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in October 2011 and found the accommodation to be spacious and clean. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and made our stay in San Francisco very enjoyable. The location of the suites was ideal for us as it is just 5 minutes walk from the wharf and all the shops & restaurants and the cable car passes the front door. The bedroom was of a good size c/w flat screen TV and the lounge area (c/w another flat screen TV) very spacious with a modern kitchenette with everything you could need provided (this included tea, coffee, sugar etc as well as washing-up materials. This was the ideal place to sit and unwind after a busy day sight seeing. We would recommend the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf to any of our friends or family visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Neighbourhood was a bit spooky at night.”
Reviews.Author: Missvideocrazy
Reviews.Content: Very good service, good because it was near the chocolate but the area wasn't very nice at night.

Reviews.Title: “Suites at Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco CA USA”
Reviews.Author: levr7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2-bedroom suite on the first floor with windows facing Hyde street. It is a little bit noisy in the morning when first cable car is passing the hotel but we still had a good sleep. Rooms are comfortable with well appointed kitchen. The only negative point is that the bathroom is very small. However that is very much compensated by the friendliness of staff. Breakfast was not included but there is an abundance of places to eat within minutes walk from the hotel. Having cable car at the door is very convenient. As a transport cable car is quite expensive ($6.00 a ride) but we have discovered that for $20.00 one can buy a 3 day ticket on all modes of public transport within San Francisco. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: WAFamilyTravel
Reviews.Content: We are SVC owners and this is our "home" time share. The location right at Fisherman's wharf, with the cable car and bus lines directly in front of the hotel cannot be beat! The infamous Buena Vista is one block down for Irish coffees - not to be missed. We stay with our family of four in a one bed room unit and there is plenty of room. A small kitchen with coffee maker, microwave,refrigerator and all the other amenities is very convenient. Our last visit, 12/19 - 12/26/2011 was fabulous. My one complaint was that our room always smelled somewhat "musty", I don't know if that is because we were four people and we are not used to the humidity of the area, but my brother-in-laws unit did not have the same smell. We will continue to stay here in SF because we are owners.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice facility”
Reviews.Author: Picker57
Reviews.Content: Our visit was delightful. Other than the 'quirky' internet & network connection, the only possible improvement would be if the unit was ready a bit earlier than the regular 4:00 check-in time. Our flight was early and, though we dropped off our luggage, we had a fair bit of time to kill. The staff was great, and this was the first time I can remember the 'consumables' being replaced every morning. We look forward to our next stay at "Suites...." Zach Kaplan

Reviews.Title: “Meet our expectation...”
Reviews.Author: chioi1922_2
Reviews.Content: Pros: Kitchen with full facilities, large sofa bed for our three kids, free wi-fi, on-site laundry; friendly and very helpful staff. Bus stops and cable-car stops near by. Walking distance to the Wharf. Supermarkets are 10 minutes walk away. Roof-top can view the bay. Cons: Beware if you're light sleeper - it could be too noisy for some as the suites is just located along the street where cable-cars pass by frequently. Some parts of our room floor would make noise when we stepped on. The sliding bathroom room door can't be locked. There is only one very tiny elevator so if you have many big piece of luggage, it will not be very convenient to move them up and down. Nevertheless, we would still recommend to the family with children who prefer a fully furnished place to stay near the Wharf area.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected...”
Reviews.Author: dme12373
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with my mother in law, had planned to stay at the hotel for 4 nights during our recent visit to San Francisco but shortly after arrival decided to leave the next morning. For several weeks prior to our visit I had followed the reviews here on TA and due to the glowing reviews perhaps my expectations were a bit unrealistic. First of all the place isn't at all impressive from outside looking more like a parking garage than a hotel. But in all fairness most reviews noted this but what wasn't noted was the unimpressive decor on the inside. The concrete balconies surrounding the inner courtyard are plain and cold...it reminded me of an Alcatraz cell block. The room itself is indeed spacious but it feels "sterile". The carpets are a very strange pattern of dark "dashes" which, to us, wasn't easy on the eyes. I had requested a room with a view, but when I opened the blinds I was shocked to find myself staring at a bare wall only a few feet away. There is somewhat of a veiw from the rooftop, but again the furnishings there are cold and uninviting. Perhaps a family with children might appreciate the kitchen rendering the ability to prepare meals in-house, but don't book this hotel expecting any charm or elegance. It has a bare bones apartment like feel...adequate but nothing special. I will say the staff was very gracious and friendly not holding us to the 72 hr. cancellation policy.

Reviews.Title: “Well-equipped units in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: ForReality
Reviews.Content: The Suites at Fisherman's Wharf was built as apartments decades ago, but the property has been nicely refurbished. The 24 units are located around a central indoor courtyard, with comfy chairs and a soothing fountain. Our 1 BR unit with full kitchen faced the nearby houses, so there wasn't any "view" - from the unit. (It was very quiet.) Some units do have balconies. The property has a roof-top terrace with a great view north to the Bay - and Alcatraz Island. The Suites are ideally situated on both bus and cable car lines, with an easy walk to two grocery stores. Great restaurants in the Fisherman's Wharf area are just down the street, along with all that there is to do in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Possible Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: snoopmolls
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! Walking distance from many attractions (Fisherman's Wharf, Fort Mason, Lombard Street, cable cars, etc.), affordable, and clean. Best of all, the property is a converted apartment building, so you get a small apartment-style suite instead of just a room. We had a bedroom, living room, full kitchen, 2 TV's, 2 large closets, dresser, table, desk, comfy bed plus a pull-out couch with chaise lounge. The suite was extremely comfortable, service was good, and front desk staff accommodated us by allowing a later checkout time on our last day (Sunday).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Leanne561
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is exactly what we needed, spacious, very clean, helpful, close to all the attractions in San Fran, totally enjoyed our stay, the rooftop garden is great, beautiful views and very relaxing after a long day sight seeing and walking. The Hotel is not flash on the outside, but the rooms are beautifully decorated and comfortable. The balcony's are good if you like fresh air and the lounge is a good size for relaxing. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in San Fransisco”
Reviews.Author: jansteve_8
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to San Fransisco with our 2 teenage daughters thats why we chose the suites and we were'nt disappointed. We had a 1 bedroom suite with a balcony on the 3rd floor with great veiws over the Wharf and Alcatraz.. The suite was perfect for our 3 night stay with all the amenities we should need including the kitchen for making breakfast and a comfortable sofa bed for the girls. The staff are very friendly and nothing is too much trouble. It is in a great location for exploring the area with easy access to the cable car which runs alongside the hotel. The cablecars start quite early in the morning and finish late but this did'nt really bother us at it adds to the experience of being in San fransisco.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: haasyboy
Reviews.Content: Have been coming here since 1997 and the property and location cant be beat for a visitor to San Francisco. Proximity to the touristy area is good and transportation to anywhere in the City is right out the front door using the Muni bus system. The accommodations are super, including nice kitchenettes, comfortable beds, and friendly, helpful staff that make this resort a great place to spend time for rest. relaxation, and exploration of the most interesting city on Earth.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy366
Reviews.Content: Staying here was a fantastic experience! Rarely (if ever) have we encountered such great facilities in a good location with outstanding staff. Upon check out, we were asked if there was anything that they could have done to improve our stay. The staff seemed to thoroughly enjoy working here and went above and beyond to make our stay special. We would happily stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing was too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: 415ClaireC415
Reviews.Content: We arrived quite late in the evening but nothing was too much trouble for the staff. They made us welcome and helped us find somewhere to eat later at night. These suites are vary spacious, there was only 2 of us in out 2 bedroom suite so we could easily loose each other :) Very clean and great facilities for self catering - a full kitchen ! Great location, minutes from Cable cars, bars, pubs and the waterfront, to walk to Pier 33 for Alcatraz was only about a 10/15 minute walk. Would definately stay here again if i was in San Francisco :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Nancy J
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic. It is easy to enjoy all the great sites and activities in the city, especially for taking a cable car ride. The accommodations were nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fisherman's Suite is awesome.”
Reviews.Author: DSullivan1052
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf for my daughter's graduation in May. It was very nice. Clean, wonderful location. The cable car picks people up right outside and there is parking. I love the way the rooms were remodeled and there was a complete kitchen. Beautiful view from the roof!

Reviews.Title: “Suites at Fishermans Wharf - great location”
Reviews.Author: Roz_woz_ere
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic - at the bottom of Hyde Street and a short walk from the piers, restaurants and bars along some of the flatter streets. View from 3rd floor roof across the harbour to Alcatraz is great Rooms were very spacious, clean and modern. Staff were friendly and helped out with our questions. We did a 3 night stop over on our way back from New Zealand and it felt like we had another mini holiday

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Sunapee17
Reviews.Content: Trolley stop at your front door with an easy walk to the Piers. Ride a bike over the Golden Gate Bridge or just sit outside on the rooftop - have lunch and enjoy the splendid view of San Francisco Bay! Beautiful rooms!

Reviews.Title: “I doubt you'll find better!”
Reviews.Author: Paulinbexley
Reviews.Content: Originally built as private apartments the room was spacious ( understatement ) and had quality furniture, the bed I would like to have shipped home, comfortable, lots of pillows and bolsters. Tv in the bedroom and larger one in the lounge. Sofa in the lounge opens up to another bed, desk area, fast wifi, fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher, waste disposal, large fridge freezer, microwave, crockery, pans etc. Even comp washing up liquid! Two coin operated washer/ dryers near underground car park. Safe parking with electric doors. Lift is on the small side but adds to the charm, free computer in reception area with printer. Room terrace is nice although skyline views are not as inspiring as they sound, that said you can see the bridge, Alcatraz and bay. The price is not cheap but the accommodation is huge, couples will be spoilt for space, families will see it as good value. Now for the best bit, location. You won't need the car, pier 39 and pier 33 (Alcatraz boat) are about a twenty minute walk, loads of restaurants and small shops around, tram up the famous Hyde street go past the door ( terminal one block away) and short walk from the famous crooked street. Tip 1- book Alcatraz trip as soon as you can, we arrived 12.00 Friday, they had vacancy for 2.55 that day or the next available trip was Monday, use hotel computer, go to alcatrazcruises.com you can see dates/ times available, book and pay on line (adult $26 Inc taxes) and print out you tickets. Tip 2 - take a jacket, bay can be windy, cells have no heating! Free audio headphones provided, fantastic trip. Back to the point, would we stay here again - i would move in permanently tomorrow if I could afford it. Sorry, nearly forgot the staff, saw three whilst we were there, all were charming and helped with local information, this place offers the full package.

Reviews.Title: “180 degree view”
Reviews.Author: KellyMD30
Reviews.Content: Best spot in San Francisco. Ghirardelli Square to the left a block, Pier 39 couple blocks to the right, can't ask for more. The top floor is perfect! What a view!! Nice place to sit and see the area with the 180 degree view. You've gotta check this out!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: gb58
Reviews.Content: After 6 weeks on the road, and 14(!!) different hotels, Suites at Fisherman's Wharf provided a great end to a great trip. The rooms are well laid out, the kitchen is very well equipped and the Staff go out of their way to make you feel at home or provide assistance. Superb location, very central yet extremely quiet. Parking, while a little tight, was very reasonably priced at $20 (for SF) We paid $40 in Seattle!! All in all, would definitely return here and have already recommended it to others. The Roof Garden provides a great view of the Bay and the city.

Reviews.Title: “Suites at Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Jewelty123
Reviews.Content: This is a prime location for site seeing! We walked everywhere from here, covered about 40 miles by the end of the week! The cable car stops right out front if you'd rather ride. The rooms are beautiful, service was excellent. We had a great time and I would gladly return!

Reviews.Title: “Top's in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: kgman1531
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. Close access to fne dining, very friendly knowledgeable staff, super nice clean accommodations, roof top deck with ALL the San Francisco views. and all at a most reasonable price! Get the idea that we will be coming back? In a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: worldrunner
Reviews.Content: A group of 4 stayed at the Suites for 6 nights and it was great. The location was perfect - right on the cable car line. It can be noisy if you are near the corner but it's fine with the windows closed. There is a wonderful rooftop patio with a 300 degree view of the bay and the wharf. The staff is wonderful and we took advantage of the parking garage at $20/night. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: Smorenzens
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the middle of evrything. A trolley car stop just outside the front door. Two blocks from the wharf and one block from Ghirdelli. An added feature is that they had onsite parking so you don't have to find parking on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: Catlowe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the week of September 11th. Staff is Excellent! Our room was very nice, quite homey infact. It was a bit noisy, but considering it is only a block from the Wharf, I guess that is to be expected. Nice patio to sit out on and watch all the action after a day of exploring. Took public transportation all week, (staff can fill you in on that) and got around nicely. Got the 7 day pass (27.00) and got our money's worth! Would definitely stay here again. Room was straightened every day and cleaned once during the week, which you don't always get. We exchanged our week in our timeshare, so the value was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “great location, big suite, we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: BostonwalkerBoston
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel for family vacations. It's expensive which is normal in SF. It's next to the Fisherman's Wharf, and the cable car stop is right on site. We though of staying in Airport to save some, but now we knnow we made the right decision. Commuting from Airport to the City will be nightmare, and you will lose your mood. We'll denifitely recomment it to family travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel, very central location”
Reviews.Author: thomasu5
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel of our US vacation, and a great starting point. Room was perfect for us, clean and spacious, with a breathtaking view to Alcatraz (and there is a roof terrace with an even better view). Many attractions in walking distance (Fisherman's Warf, Lombard Street, even Coit Tower). Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent- but our room needed double glazing-right next to tram stop!”
Reviews.Author: hogfairfive
Reviews.Content: After looking at reviews on Tripadvisor before The Suites looked idea, and it was apart from the noise of the trams, literaly next to our bedroom window. Good job I had brought some ear plugs! Good location, accomodation excellent and staff v friendly. We had the room below the roof garden that was a little noisy too! We also asked for a quiet and high up room.

Reviews.Title: “We loved staying here!”
Reviews.Author: rsweezy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and had a wonderful time. The suite was very nice. It was very comfortable for me, my sister-in-law, and two daughters (ages 23 and 25). We had a huge master bedroom with king size bed, one full bath and living area with queen size sleeper sofa as well as a full kitchen. It is within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Pier 33 (Alcatraz Landing), Ghiredelli Square, The Cannery and Lombard Street. The staff were very friendly, courteous and most helpful even arranging transportation for us to the airport the morning we left. I would highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location and Super Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: SandK333
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting the San Francisco area, I highly highly highly recommend the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf. Some will say that the hotel is dated and lacks ammenities found in mega hotel chains. But, these things only add to the beauty of this place. The hotel seems as if it is a converted apartment/condo space. All of the rooms are at least a one bedroom suite. However, the place feels more like an apartment or home rather than a sterile hotel room. It was clean and inviting with no troubles. There is no pool, but the advantage to that is there are less children in the hotel. In fact, I only saw 2 during our stay. That is a plus for couples and adults that want to get away. Instead of a pool, this hotel has a rooftop lounge area with an unobstructed view to Alcatrez and Ghiardelli Square. You can also see both the Golden Gate Bridge and the Bay Bridge from there. The rooftop is worth the price of admission. Now let's discuss the location. There isn't a more perfect location. The hotel is 2 blocks from the Wharf, one block from Ghiardelli Square, and two trolley car stops from Lombard Street. It is situated on a corner that has a trolley stop and many bus routes. We used the buses and trolley to tour the entire city. The location cannot be beat! It was away from most tourists to be peaceful, yet close enough to feel safe walking around the hotel. There are plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby, as well as grocery stores to stock up the kitchen. The fully functional kitchen was perfect for a week long stay. The service at this hotel was top notch. The front desk staff provided excellent recommendations and knew how to navigate the city efficiently. They provided hints and tips on discounted events, including concerts and transportation. The cleaning staff were top notch and provided everything we asked for. All-in-all, great service!

Reviews.Title: “triathlon racing/endurance sports”
Reviews.Author: kevin o
Reviews.Content: i came to town to race see the water front and rest. This place is a 5 min. walk from the swim beach and 15 min. walk to the start of the race. You can rent a bike 30 steps away and cover the entire warf on foot. It is very clean, quiet , and private. I will be back and when i do i will check this place first. ( had a great swim from alcatraz accross the bay). looking forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: NorthVanFamilyofFour
Reviews.Content: Instead of getting the 2 BR that we booked the friendly desk person apologized and offered us a 1BR + a rollaway bed for the first night of our 3 night stay. He reduced our rate and also gave us free parking and said we could move to the 2BR for our last 2 nights. After setting up, we found the room comfortable enough and didn't want to move from the front of the building to the back, so we happily stayed where we were. The room was very clean and nicely decorated, the kitchen was stocked with brand new utensils and cookware and we had a balcony with a peek a boo view of Alcatraz. We found this location to be perfect for all the sightseeing we did in our two days. Friends of mine had suggested that maybe Union Square was where we should stay, but we loved this location and only went up to Union Square to do some shopping once. While we were in San Fran the weather was pretty cool and windy, so unfortunately we didn't get to sit up on the rooftop deck and enjoy the view. We barely got to use our own balcony, but it was sure nice to be able to step up and feel the temperature to decide on what to wear before venturing out for the day. The hotel is only a few blocks walk to Lombard (the crookedest street) and one block to Ghiradelli Square's delicious chocolate shop and a couple blocks to fun Fisherman's Wharf. We rented bikes from the Blazing Saddles shop on the next block and loved riding over the Golden Gate Bridge and to Sausalito. I highly recommend this day trip and this hotel to everyone! We also enjoyed our trip to Alcatraz and it's easy enough to walk to Pier 39.

Reviews.Title: “It should be rated higher than #4 in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: mrhMaine
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in all respects! Even if I tried I could not find anything wrong with the accomadations or service. All the staff were frendly and helpful. We had a 1 bedroom suite which was more than enough for the two of us. Very quiet & clean. Even with no air conditioning in the middle of August we were never to warm. The staff recommened the Buna Vista Restraunt just one block down the street,which was the best. We did not need a car as the public transportation was more tha adequate.This was one of our best vacations ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiGirl05
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exceptional. The rooms were very big with full kitchen, living room and separate bedroom. The price was very reasonable for the great suite you get. Very clean and quiet hotel. The staff were outstanding making suggestions on restaurants and places to see. Everyone was friendly and professional We had a small issue with the heat in our room they fixed it right away and even left a gift basket for the inconvenience. Very close to all the action in Fisherman's Wharf. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay! We will definately be back..”
Reviews.Author: jeff p
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious and very comforatble, with all the amenities you need to enjoy your stay. The full size kitchen allowed us to eat in/sleep after a busy day of sightseeing. Our rooms view of the Golden Gate Bridge, Alzatraz, and portions of the Bay bridge were magnificent..Staff was friendly and informative on where to visit, what transporation to use, etc. etc. Oh yeah, the cable car running in front of the suites was not back either.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: diamondbacksfan98
Reviews.Content: Our daughter lives in SF and we visit every year. We love to stay in the Fisherman's Wharf area, which tends to be pricey. This place was a block from Ghiradella Square, and right alongside the Hyde Street cable line. We paid $179 a night, had a spacious living room with a bedroom, kitchenette,and balcony. The kitchenette was fully stocked and helped save a few dollars on breakfasts. The staff was extremely helpful, I mean extremely! And don't forget to grab a beer or a glass of wine and go up to the rooftop area. It is spectacular!! Great place, great service, great price.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than expected - will stay there whenever we are in SF”
Reviews.Author: amk0414
Reviews.Content: We checked out the reviews and photos of the hotel before booking, but we liked it even better than expected. The roof top deck is fabulous, as is the lounge area inside. We had a great view of the wharf from our room, which was spacious with modern decor. We loved having the full kitchen and there is a Safeway grocery store within walking distance. We had no problems parking in the garage and were so happy we decided to stay in this hotel as opposed to some of the other "chain" hotels nearby. We are already talking about a bigger family trip and definitely will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location”
Reviews.Author: 60fun
Reviews.Content: The staff is very helpful, and it is very clean -- the LOCATION is great and I love the roof top - you can watch the trolley cars turn on Hyde St . I highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Looking Forward to Next Visit Here”
Reviews.Author: Ken M
Reviews.Content: This property is excellently located at Hyde & North Point, the first stop up the hill on the Cable Car. You’re within walking distance of all the Fisherman’s Wharf attractions: Ghirardeli Square (be sure to visit the cupcake place), Pier 39, souvenir shopping, the famous and hole-in-the-wall restaurants, and don’t miss the Boudin sourdough bread store/restaurant. While there is onsite parking at the Suites, a car really isn’t necessary (or first choice) in getting around the city. Two major SF Muni (bus) lines (30 & 47) pick you up and/or drop you off right in front of the building (or diagonally across the Hyde/North Point intersection), making it easy and cheap to get downtown (shopping, theatres, restaurants), AT&T Park, the Castro, the Haight Ashbury, and Golden Gate Park (including the De Young Museum). That said, if you’re one to cook and eat in, the fully equipped kitchen makes it easy to do so. Safeway and Trader Joe’s markets within walking (mostly flat!) distance. Once the clouds disappear (it happens more than you think!), the views are spectacular. During our July 4 holiday week there, we had excellent views of the San Francisco Bay (including Alcatraz) to the north, of the Oakland Hills/Berkeley to the west, and the surprisingly picturesque bridges. The newly refurbished roof deck makes it possible to see even further, great for fireworks as well as the lights of the surrounding cities. The unit has been updated in the last year or so with new furniture, carpeting, kitchen appliances, bedding, and flat panel HD TV. While you might not use it all that much, you do get local cable TV with probably 100 television and radio channels. Free Wi-Fi makes it easy to see what there is to do and how to get there and back. Since there are only 24 units, the excellent staff (front office, housekeeping) are quick to respond

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a place. Ticked all our boxes”
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay if visiting SFO for a sightseeing vacation. Not the best looking place externally, but wow, inside is different. Spacious, clean, lovely beds and linen. Well equiped kitchen area. Much better than staying in the local hotels with their crazy prices. Stay here, you get all the benefits of a hotel plus much more. They should charge to use the decking area on the roof - what a view. Would stay here again with no hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: NJItalian
Reviews.Content: Only 2 blocks up from Fisherman's Wharf. We had a studio which slept 4. Very clean, great housekeeping service, friendly front desk and spectacular roof top views. 1 block from main trolley stop but right outside is another trolley stop and electric car/bus stop. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a perfect place”
Reviews.Author: Mrchops
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during our California vacation, and we were very happy with the hotel and it's location. We were not sure if we wanted to stay in the city or not, but glad we did. The trolley stops right outside the hotel, it's only a 3 block walk to Fisherman's Wharf and there are many restaurants within walking distance. The room itself was very nice, although the bathroom was small(not really important). Very well furnished, full kitchen if you need it, dining area, a balcony overlooking the street, and a rooftop with tables and chairs with views of the bay. We opted for the on-sight garage for 2 days and felt very safe where we left it. This is a really nice hotel. Desk staff very happy to give info, maps, directions etc. without an attitude. Kudo's. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, well equipped suites, amazing staff.”
Reviews.Author: LUV2travel-notmuch$
Reviews.Content: We chose this apartment hotel over a conventional hotel because we had expected to be travelling with our teenage son and thought the extra space would be handy. Now that we've stayed at the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf, we'd pick it over a hotel any time. The location is fantastic. Just a couple of short blocks up from the Hyde Street pier, the Maritime Museum and the start of the cable car line. And the Suites are just at the edge of a residential area, so the neighbourhood is lovely. We could easily walk to all the waterfront sites (Pier 39, Pier 33) and Union Square was just a very short bus/cable car ride away. There are ,any restaurants along High Point and Jefferson Streets, just a block or two away. There are numerous buses and a cable car line that stop right at the door, so getting around is easy. The units themselves are extremely well equipped, despite having fairly small kitchen and bathroom, and a family of four could easily and comfortably live in them for a week or more. The kitchens have combo microwave/convection ovens plus hot plates and all the cooking tools you could want. Large living room; big screen televisions in both living and bed rooms. The apartments are located off of a central atrium, filled with comfy chairs and lush plants. There is a "business centre" in the front lobby with access to free (if a little slow) internet and phone. There are four first floor units that have access to a private, shared patio, which is an oasis of calm, featuring teak patio furniture and potted plants. Be sure to ask for one of these when you book. Most of the other units have patios overlooking High Point Street or no patios. The top floor deck has incredibly comfortable Muskoka (I think Americans call them Adirondack) chairs and an amazing view of the city. The on-site laundry facilities are clean, handy and cheap. A great convenience for a family travelling light or taking a longer trip. The front desk staff were extremely knowledgeable about the city and very friendly and helpful. They easily rivalled the skill of the concierges at the better hotels around town. We highly, highly recommend this hotel to any travelling families or to those who just like to prepare their own breakfasts before starting out for a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: jdichosa
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and two and a half year old daughter) had a wonderful stay at the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf! The location is perfect! We had a suite adjacent to North Point and had a wonderful view of alcatraz from our balacony. The views from the viewing deck on the third floor are breath-taking. Everyone on staff made our stay very comfortable. They were very courteous and friendly. Their customer service is to be commended. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting the SF area. It is literally a block from Ghiradelli Square and the Fisherman's Wharf and right outside the door is the trolley stop that takes you to union square. Just a short stroll away is Pier 39. We spent four days and three nights in SF and enjoyed a morning jog twice. The golden gate bridge is just 3.5 miles away via walking/jogging trail and the bay bridge is only 2.5 miles away in the opposite direction.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: rockystuff
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks bland from the outside, we almost missed it. Once we got inside, the staff was very helpful in suggesting a place to eat nearby (Boudin Sour Dough bread place). The room was huge, with a living area, a separate kitchenette, complete with full refrigerator, microwave, 2 cooktop stove. It allowed us to pick up cereal for breakfast--our usual choice anyway. The living room looked out over SF Bay, and since we were on the 3rd floor, we had a great view. For an even better view, we went up to the roof, where they have lounge chairs set up, and a nice wind block that allowed it to be quite warm, despite the 60 degree day. Fortunately, it was sunny, and we saw views of the Golden Gate Bridge, Fisherman's Wharf, and the Bay Bridge. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom adequate sized. The room was a little noisy, since we looked right out on the bus line and cable car line, but the cable cars shut down for several hours at night, so it got quieter. Our friend had a room on the back side, and although she only had a view of a brick wall, her room was much quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect for families, clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: dmMc
Reviews.Content: My sister, niece and I stayed at the Suites at Fisherman’s Wharf for 6 nights in June. This was a girls trip to celebrate my niece's graduation. First, this is a small timeshare resort and not a hotel, as a result do not expect the normal hotel services like on-site restaurants, gym, concierge, etc. However, unlike other timeshares I have been to, there is a daily maid service. What you do get is more space and kitchen facilities, which I prefer. It is great to have your morning coffee and breakfast and relax before a busy day of sight-seeing. We had a 1 bedroom suite on the 1st floor, which had a kitchen, living area with dining with access to a patio that is not private, 1 small bathroom with tub and shower. There is a small elevator, similar to what you find in European hotels that is fine for getting your luggage to your room - actually larger than some European hotels I have been to – LOL! There is a nice roof top patio that we enjoyed, it has a great view of the harbor and Alcatraz. The room was very clean and we really liked the location. It is a short walk to Fisherman's Wharf with a great selection of restaurants and the cable car stop is right outside the door. We did rent a car for two days because we made an overnight trip to Monterey, but you do not need a car if you plan to see the city sights. The MUNI system is great and day trips to wine country are available online or ask the person at the front desk for info . We found the front desk personnel very helpful . We also took a small group tour of Chinatown with Wok Wiz which I highly recommend. Also, if you have not been to Alcatraz, that is a must. CowGirl Creamery at the Ferry Building – yum!

Reviews.Title: “Good room”
Reviews.Author: DGR1968
Reviews.Content: Friendly, clean, great location, fantastic price. Garage parking for 20 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: LLConsult
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days over our anniversary. Very friendly staff. Accomodations similar to what you would find in an apartment - full kitchen with all amenities. Nicely furnished rooms, comfortable bed. Small work area for a computer (there is complimentary Wi-fi). We were on 3rd floor with a nice view of Fisherman's Wharf and Alcatraz Island. We pretty much walked to everything we wanted to see and do. One earlier review rated this property only fair because of noise. If you want quiet, anywhere near Fisherman's Wharf is probably not a good choice - we had no issues with noise. One other thing to mention - very limited parking. If you are driving, request a parking space when you make your reservation - the staff will try to accomodate you. All in all, a very enjoyable stay and we are recommending this property to any of our relatives and friends that are planning to stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view, great room”
Reviews.Author: MJensen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Suites at Fisherman's Wharf two times as an owner in Shell Vacations Club. The rooms are clean, well equipped, and nicely furnished. From this hotel you will have easy access to the trolley lines, F Train, and Muni buses. I haven’t had a car while staying at this location, so I am not sure about the parking situation. I never asked. Other reviewers have posted about the noise from the street. While it is noisy throughout the day, the noise never woke me in the morning or kept me from sleeping at night. The staff members were polite and accommodating to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good, all else is FAIR.”
Reviews.Author: MiamiMo
Reviews.Content: This appears to have been an apartment building which was converted into a hotel. Noise Level - Horrible - the hotel is right next to the street trolley lane. Up through midnight and starting at 6:00 AM, it would feel as if our room would shake every few minutes as the trolley would pass by. It made it difficult to sleep. Parking - Horrible - there is no valet parking available. Must park in a very small parking lot with no space. Had to fold in my mirrors and come out the side sliding door of the minivan because the doors did not have space to open. Rooms - Spacious, but old. Rooms show their age and could use a major renovation. Requested a high room with a view. Was given a room on the 2nd floor with no view. Staff - There was only 1 staff around at night and in the day that we saw. The one staff person was very friendly and professional. Elevator - What a nightmare. The elevator fits about 2 people. I had to make so many trips up and down to bring my family's luggage from the first floor to the 2nd floor. Food - There was no restaurant. There were not even vending machines. We were told we would have to walk a few blocks to a store to get drinks. This is definately not a good hotel for families as it is very small and not spacious. If you are traveling alone or as couples, then you will have less issues with the space.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Location”
Reviews.Author: GDJWinchester_Ma
Reviews.Content: Our 2-bedroom unit at The Suites @ Fisherman's Wharf, on the corner of Hyde & Northpointe, was a short walk to the Piers and our roof top terrace view looked right out @ Alcatraz in the Bay. What a great location! Our unit was very comfortable, albeit not on the large size. Everything had been redecorated in the past two years, and you could see that they really put a lot into it. The staff was terrific and with this being our first extended trip in San Fran, we relied on their advice and were never disappointed. If back in the area, we would definitely try to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous find with a great view”
Reviews.Author: pam_macchlerie
Reviews.Content: The Suites at Fisherman's Wharf is a gem in the city. Only 24 suites with ambiance, plenty of room and a fabulous view of the bay and Alcatraz from the rooftop patio. Only two blocks from the famous Buena Vista cafe and cable car turnaround. Great service from the staff and an excellent value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us.”
Reviews.Author: GetawayGangAlberta
Reviews.Content: This hotel was built in 1958 as an apartment building and converted to a residential hotel in 1960. If you're looking for a new modern luxury resort, this is not the place for you. The style is what you would expect considering its vintage, the bathroom and kitchen are small but functional and the railings on the balconies are slightly rusty metal. Also it is on a major bus route and beside the trolley tracks so there is lots of street noise. For this part of our trip, it was the perfect hotel for us (two adults and a teenager). We had stayed overnight at the airport and arrived at the hotel at 10 am, they provided us with secure luggage storage so we could enjoy our day. When we checked in that afternoon we found our room to be very roomy and very clean and the staff friendly. We stayed in room 301, a one bedroom suite for four nights. The elevator was interesting but slow so I wouldn't recommend the third floor unless you are fit enough to use the stairs, which we did. There was an in-room safe plenty large enough for the laptop and other stuff. The kitchen and bathroom were dated but clean. The bed was comfortable and the sofa bed was very good with a real mattress and good canvas support. The balcony was functional and the roof top deck was great, we even ate our supper there one night (very good vietmamese take out from Grandeho's Kamekyo less than 1/2 block away). The do allow smoking on the roof top deck which we didn't like. We didn't have a car for this portion of our trip but we did buy a multiday transit pass which worked out great. There is a lot to see and do within walking distance, we used the transit system to go to the Academny of Science which was amazing, the cable car museum which was great also and to Little Italy for an amazing authentic Italian lunch at the Original US Cafe. We took the Mr Toad 90 minute "Hop around the City tour" on our first full day which gave us great information about the city and the recommendation for the Original US Cafe. Michaelis Food Store just a block west, had a great selection of wine and beer. Lori's Diner in Garadelli Square makes great milkshakes and homemade apple pie. The Pier Market had very good Red Curry and Coconut Mussels and Scoma's makes really good clam chowder. We had Vietnamese from Grandeho's Kamekyo twice because it was so good. For us this was the perfect hotel for this location, clean, comfortable and with room to for the teenager to have some private time. There is no pool or gym but walking around San Francisco was plenty of exercise.

Reviews.Title: “The Suites at Fisherman's Wharf are an excellent choice for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Bojerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Suites twice and will stay there again if we go back to San Francisco. You will find The Suites to be clean, quite, nice for the price, and provides great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location and newly updated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Mike8641
Reviews.Content: We come here every year for Bay to Breakers weekend. The location is unbeatable, but we have been particularly impressed with the great service and the upgrades to the rooms. The rooftop deck is a fabulous place to meet friends for a glass of wine and take in the views of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough... A perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: Ali_Kissee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited here on our honeymoon at the beginning of May 2011. San Francisco was our last stop on the way up the coast from Orange County prior to heading back to Indianapolis. At the last minute we decided to come into San Francisco a day early. Unfortunately this place didn't have any rooms available and we ended up paying way too much at another hotel just one block down the road. Luckily this place had rooms open for our last two nights. The outside of the hotel looked a little dingy, but the inside was amazing. It was the best place that we stayed during the entire week and a half visit to California. I'm only sorry to say that we didn't find any other places like this. The room was very spacious. It wasn't like the other places that you walked in and it was just a room and bathroom, this place had a full living/dining room with foldout couch, a kitchen with a convection microwave, dishes and full sized refridgerator, and a seperate bedroom. Everything in the room was very modern and didn't look outdated at all. It was the only hotel that we stayed in with flat screen tv's. We were able to request a balcony room so that we could sit out and watch all the hussle and bussle. Not only did we have a balcony, the roof was also open to guests, and the view was stunning. For all the smokers out there, San Francisco is very smoke free. You are not able to smoke on the balcony here, but we were allowed to smoke on the roof as long as we didn't offend any other guests. Most of the other hotels wouldn't even allow you to smoke anywhere on the property. We were only a very short 3 block walk to the main strip of the wharf, and very close to Ghiradelli Square. We have 3 boys, and have already decided that when we come back we are going to make sure that we book this place well in advance, as the kitchen area will help keep the food & drink costs down. There is a very elegant chef owned restaurant across the street (SW corner of Hyde and Bay), so if you enjoy fine dining be sure to bring nice attire to wear. The parking is very affordable compared to other places in the area (1/2 the cost). The hotel attendants were wonderful, even called to let us know that they were there to help if we needed help with anything in the area. There are so many wonderful things I could say about this place. I call it a diamond in the rough because you just can't see how beautiful the inside is by looking at the outside of the building.

Reviews.Title: “A true surprise and great value in Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: rwking
Reviews.Content: All staff were extremely friendly and the resort is very well maintained. The property is perfectly located and an exceptional value. I will take an apartment setting at an attractive rate over an overpriced hotel room any day and that is what you have here. The photos online do not do it justice. I will recommend this to friends and business associates and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Crafts1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf and could not have been more pleased. The room was spacious, the view was amazing! We looked out our window and had a perfect view of Alcatraz and the bay. To our left was the Golden Gate Bridge. The view, the staff and accommodations were simply wonderful! Ken and Linda, Los Angeles

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for those that would rather walk then take a car.”
Reviews.Author: Travcan
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect. We were able to walk just about everywhere we wanted to go. The ferry to Sausilito, ferry to Alcatraz and the Pier where our tour to the Napa Valley started were all within walking distance. The Muni bus was just outside our hotel and the trolley bus a short block away to all our other destinations. The rooms are on the older side but were extremely clean and the front desk staff were very knowledgeable and keen to help us with all our tourist questions.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, friendly staff, fantastic rooftop views and protected parking”
Reviews.Author: MarcieKathyRyan
Reviews.Content: This is my first visit since the renovation; wow great improvements. As always the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The location of this property can't be beat, walking distance to streetcar, 1st class dining and great people watching. We travel extensively worldwide and have been owners of this property since 2004 and by far San Francisco is our favorite city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, close to Wharf (Ghiradelli's Square)”
Reviews.Author: LHemp
Reviews.Content: We are a family of six. We walked to Alcatraz - which was a little walk from the hotel but when we walked home, stopped by Ghiradelli's for ice cream and treats. (They stay open til 1100pm) pros - hotel is great location, has a balcony view on roof of building over looking bay, the cleanliness inside the hotel and our room was remarkable, The rooms were spacious - we stayed in a 2 room with a pull out couch. kitchen was well supplied, there was a old style elevator still in use - the kids thought it was great Cons - right in front of trolly tracks, VERY limited parking in garage - but hey this is downtown San Francisco All in all the hotel exceeded our needs. Would recommend for families and people wanting to stay close to the wharf for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite home away from home in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: NJ_ThursdaysChild
Reviews.Content: I stay here every time I go to SanFrancisco, and have for the past 5 years. It's my own little home away from home, a comfortable and clean apartment with a cable car stop right outside the front door, and one of San Francisco's, if not the country's, top restaurants right across the street.. And the view from the newly refurbuished roof deck! Fabulous!! You can't beat the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf location or the value, and Miguel and his staff make every stay a pleasure. I'm back there in Augusr 2011, and I can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: teresa052960
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at a great location and at a reasonable price. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and many restaurants and stores. The only negative I found was that there was no air conditioning. There is a ceiling fan in the bedroom but it was a little warm for the people sleeping on the convertable couch in the living room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service.”
Reviews.Author: GemmaJune
Reviews.Content: Loved the roof-top view. Walk 2 blocks and you are at Fisherman's Wharf, cable car depot or Ghiradeli square. Room was large and clean with modern furniture and 2 flat screen TVs. Bed was very comfortable. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place, would easily stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Guddie
Reviews.Content: I was here with my wife and another friend for one night, on our first trip to San Francisco. The reason I chose to stay here was the location, and it definitely was a fantastic location, right in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf and walking distance to just about everything else, which was great since our trip was so short. We booked the one bedroom suite. It was big and beautiful. It had a large living room with a pull-out queen couch. High quality furnishings and nice TV and DVD player. The kitchen was a small-but-full kitchen. Fridge, utensils, pots and pans, glasses, stove, etc. The bedroom had a very comfortable king size bed, a TV, alarm clock/iPod dock, and a decent closet. One bathroom, but it was large and very clean and well stocked. Shower water was hot for 3 showers in a row. We loved the room, it really felt like an apartment in the city. Parking was very convenient, inside of a garage "under" the hotel, accessible from the street to the north. It is only for hotel guests, and is very secure. It is small down there with limited spaces, but there were always a couple open during our stay. Parking is expensive, but comparable to anything else in the city. We also thoroughly enjoyed the rooftop deck. It was open 24 hours, so after a night out on the town, we relaxed up there with great views of the city. The hotel front-desk staff was perfect, very nice and helpful. They let us check-out late, park in the garage after checking out while grabbing breakfast, and they gave us a razor since we forgot ours. All with a great attitude and efficiency. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco. Great location, rooms, and staff made for top-notch accommodations at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tom-Anne-Travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I come to SF a few times a year and this was our first stay at the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf. The location is great and the view from the rooftop is wondrous. The suites are not luxurious but they are very charming which I loved! From the moment we arrived to the moment we left I felt well cared-for by staff. The rooms are large and the common areas are spacious. Everything you need is provided. We took another couple with us and felt the 2 bedroom set up was spacious enough. In addition, cars are parked in a garage that is secure & safe.

Reviews.Title: “Greatl location”
Reviews.Author: BangkokExpat54
Reviews.Content: Great location for families. The rooms are also good for larger groups

Reviews.Title: “quite,spacious and a fabulous location for public transportation and sites”
Reviews.Author: traveler8882
Reviews.Content: enjoyed our stay-located on the bus and trolly lines everything was within easy reach--could walk to the wharf area--the suites were large,quite with excellent daily service--staff was very friendy and helpful--if we go back to san francisco this is where we will stay

Reviews.Title: “A New Favorite”
Reviews.Author: betsytb
Reviews.Content: We had such a great stay here! The staff was incredible and the rooms were perfect! We loved the location and the rooftop deck was such a nice amenity. The view was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sdportillo
Reviews.Content: I could not have asked for more from a hotel. The room was lovely. The view great. The location suberb. The staff may have been the best thing of all. Wonderful, helpful, friendly. I'd stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “marvelous experience”
Reviews.Author: rbtdg1
Reviews.Content: Found the service to be great, the rooms were clean and lovely. Front desk personal very friendly and helpful. This place is so centrally located, it's great-cable cars, ghiradelli, the wharf and restaurants. The muni passes for the buses and trolley were a god send. Made it so easy for going around town and going down town to shop. This was simply a great vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly, helpful employees, super rooms, outstanding views!”
Reviews.Author: Becky061
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this hotel. Just a long block's walk to the wharf, nice to stroll along. Trolley station close also. The personnel at the hotel were wonderful, friendly, helpful, accomodating. The view from the rooms is outstanding! The sun roof is great fun. Rooms are spacious, kitchen fully equiped. Parking is not cheap but is under the building, inside. Lots of super great places to eat within easy walking distance. Super shoping at the Wharf. Easy access to downtown SF and to the bridge, etc. We will definitely go back to the Suites at fisherman's Wharf. Loved it there!

Reviews.Title: “Love to stay there, try to stay there when ever we are in the City.”
Reviews.Author: luvbubbles7
Reviews.Content: Our favorite place to stay in the City. Close to everything, Right by the street car line.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great upgrades”
Reviews.Author: LAfanla
Reviews.Content: Great location, near cable car, Ghiradelli's, Wharf, etc. New updated furniture. Comfortable for family with kids. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Suites at Fisherman's Wharf was absolutely wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: fletchbs
Reviews.Content: "Fantastic" sums up our stay at Suites of Fisherman's Wharf. We stayed with a timeshare trade through Interval International and had a 2-bedroom with kitchen, living room and 1 bath. It is a PERFECT location so close to the bay and cable car, grocery store and restaurants. The rooftop patio was a highlight for relaxing with a glass of wine and soak in the gorgeous view of the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz and the surrounding bay area. The staff are all great and respond to any request immediately. From talking with other guests, we understand the entire place has been recently remodeled. The furnishings were all first class--nice linens, 2 large flat screen TVs, kitchen providing all our needs although we only cooked breakfast, however could have cooked full meals with ease. One thing that highly impressed me was, upon my return I received a survey regarding our stay. I responded, although I generally feel these are very generic and may or may not be read. I only had a couple of negatives to report. Within a day, I received a response back from the manager addressing the specific comments I had made. One being the internet connection dropped on occasion and was told their IT dept was in the process of changing providers as they were aware of this problem. The only other comment suggested adding a table to the laundry room and the response from the manager was he had gone out that day and purchased supplies to build one and could not believe in their remodeling the laundry room, had overlooked putting one in. The fast action on just a suggestion was very impressive. I hope to be back at Suites at Fisherman's Wharf in the future and definitely recommend it to anyone planning a trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Lordmike14
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom suite. It was spacious, well appointed and very comfortable. The full kitchen was handy. The staff were available and helpful. The location was very handy for our first visit to San Francisco - within walking distance to many tourist spots (Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 + the seals, Ghirardelli Square) and supermarkets; easy access to public transport (the bus stop to downtown via Chinatown is right out front, and the tram car route 2 which runs pass the pier for Alcatraz and the Ferry Building Marketplace to downtown is an easy 2 blocks away); and the cable car stop for Lombard St (Crooked St) is right out front of the hotel. The hotel is pretty much located at the base of the hill, before the serious slopes start, so walking to and from the hotel daily was relatively easy for us. Lombard St (Crooked St) is a short distance from the hotel up a very steep hill - I took it upon myself to walk up there, and it only took about 10 mins each way at an easy pace. On the walk back from Pier 39, we pass the stores at Fishermans Wharf that sell the freshly cooked crabs and had them "to go" to enjoy back at the hotel a couple of times - they were delicious (and I normally don't even like crabs)! There was free wifi in our suite, and there's a complimentary business center (i.e. computer with a printer) near reception for guests' use - very handy for printing out our tour vouchers for the next day, etc. Room service was every couple of days, but they did come and collect the rubbish daily (i.e. they got the crab shells out of our suite before too long!). The hotel does not have a lot of suites, and we found that it booked out early, so if you're interested, get onto it sooner rather than later!

Reviews.Title: “Check your reservation: they booked me into wrong hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leopoldskron
Reviews.Content: From the reviews this looked like a great place so I picked up the phone to make a reservation. Got through to the central reservations for the company (the number on the website of the hotel) and had a very pleasant conversation, selected a room, and thought all was great... until I got the confirmation in my email and found they had booked me into Anaheim rather than San Fran/Fisherman's Wharf. So I called to cancel (of course) and then got the runaround about whether they had space available. I called central reservations and was told there was space available, but only for a minimum 2-day stay (I only wanted one night), but only the front desk could override. Front desk said they couldn't override... and that their schedule showed no space. Meanwhile I was looking at their own website's schedule which DID show space available. Front desk said he didn't know why the website said there was space. So bottom line: with a big outfit like this, that has multiple properties around the country, make sure you confirm where you are booked. Front desk's best guess of what happened to me? "Perhaps he or she in central reservations hit the wrong button and pulled up Anaheim instead of San Francisco."

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Seriously1971
Reviews.Content: Went for a girls weekend. Location is excellent. Amentities are great. Roof top deck provides beautiful views. Clean and affordable. Will bring the kids next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, good choice!”
Reviews.Author: poiboiz
Reviews.Content: Hyde-Powell Cable car stop right outside of the front door! Only one block from the cable car turnaround (ticket purchases). The 1,3 or 7 day muni passes are the best way to go! It allows you to use all of the different forms of public trans. Parking is very limited at the resort and a car is not recommended. We had a deluxe 1 BR unit with kitchenette. It was perfect. Queen Bed in the master, queen sofa sleeper in the spacious living room. Views of the bay and Alcatraz were nice. The rooms were really clean. The building is older but renovated well. Two blocks from Fishermans wharf and a block from Ghiradelli! Nice place to come "home" to after a hectic day running around the city!

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: jeannieberns
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location! Great staff, very helpful with suggestions & questions. Roomy & great kitchen besides! Love having a refrigerator & sink especially. Plus great roof top terrace with fabulous view of bay! We are coming back in July for longer stay! Jeannie & Frank Berns

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: kakil
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful find. We were travelling to San Fran after a trip to Ireland to visit my husband's family. The trip to Ireland was a bit of a disaster due to weather issues, illnesses etc so by the time we arrived in SF we were exhausted. The Suites at Fisherman's Wharf were exactly what we were looking for. The staff were so incredibly helpful and friendly. The location is second to none and the Suites were gorgeous and roomy. It was great to have the kitchen as we were travelling with our 10 month old baby girl so could cater for ourselves when we wished to. There is very little I could fault. Probably only thing is that they have late check in (4pm) and an early check out (10am) but besides that it was a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and people”
Reviews.Author: TCon108
Reviews.Content: Wonderful accommodating staff provided suggestions, directions, a sense of welcome and warmth. Property is located steps from Ghirardelli Square, a block from Fisherman's Wharf and on a cable car line, but is quiet and peaceful. Our suite included a bedroom, a large living room and a small, fully-equipped kitchen. This hotel was a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Steve8063rd
Reviews.Content: This was a great place! Nine of us, including 2 teenagers, and a 10 & 8 year old, took two rooms (each one was a 2 bedroom suite). The kitchen facilities were appreciated, and the location was GREAT! It's a block from Ghiradelli Square and 2 blocks from the Fisherman's Wharf area. Some of us found the cable car's early jaunts a little noisy, but isn't that what we're in San Francisco for?? Overall, this is a great value for a group that wants to be "where the action is."

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jorgenhaa
Reviews.Content: This is a suitehotel with huge apartments. The 2 bedroom apartments is facing the street with the cablecars, beacause of that it is a bit noicy in the bedrooms. One king sice bed and one queenbed. Nice kitchen. I belive that the apartments once a time where smokingrooms, because there was a little smell of that in our room. Beautiful view from the roof toward Alcatraz and Golde gate. Not far away from a lot of restaurangs with good dinning. The parking (valet) under the hotel is really smal. Free internet. Washingmachines. Friendly staff. Grocery store 2 blocks away

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: PollyannaSmithson
Reviews.Content: We had relatives stay here because it was super close to everything that tourists would want to see in SF. They loved their stay. We loved it because we didnt have to cater to them for any tourist attractions. The location is perfect for any travelers! a bit pricy but it is SF.

Reviews.Title: “Your one place to stay in San Fran: Great service, great views!”
Reviews.Author: sjbbc50
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place to stay where we had the option to cook in, to be able to have a short walk to many attractions and had great views of the city. This is it! We absolutely loved this place! Short walk to the waterfront, Ghidadelli's next door and cable cars right at your door. But the best was the unique deck on the roof - super views and a great place for coffee in the morning and drinks at night! Staff was kind, service was super - they are always looking for ways to make your stay enjoyable. You can trust the Suites to make your visit the best ever - we won't hesitate to come back here again!

Reviews.Title: “A new favorite hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: CFCOX
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have traveled to San Francisco almost every October for years to celebrate our anniversary, and have stayed at almost every 4 star hotel at least once. For the last several years we have settled in on the Argonaut as our favorite, but this October we decided to try The Suites at Fisherman's Wharf, based on the reviews at Trip Advisor. We now have a new favorite hotel !
