The location was as convenient as the Argonaut (two blocks away), near our beloved Buena Vista, many of our favorite restaurants, and a block from the Cable Car turnaround on Hyde Street. What set the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf apart from all others was the personal service of the incredibly friendly and helpful staff. The hotel itself is small, but well appointed. The suites were clean and the beds comfortable. The full kitchen was a bonus which we really didn't take advantage of on this trip, but will remember for next year. There is a wonderful rooftop patio with a great view of the bay that we greatly enjoyed, too. Our trip this year was flawed in some ways, however, as I had not planned on the S.F. Giants having a playoff game that week, and had not foreseen that the weather, for the first time ever, would be a problem. We could not get a reservation at our chosen restaurants, and taxis were almost impossible to find. The city was simply packed. But, while the weather outside was frightful, the hotel staff was delightful ! The got us into their recommended restaurants, and somehow found us a taxi every time we needed one. They treated us like we were family from out of town ! An example: Being from Oklahoma, I was counting on watching the Oklahoma Sooners play a nationally televised football game on Saturday night. About 30 minutes before the game started, we realized that the station the game was on had no sound. I called Chris at the front desk, and immediately someone was at the room to correct the problem. But it seemed the problem could not be fixed, so they brought in another brand-new T.V. and hooked it up. It still had no sound, so they brought in ANOTHER new T.V. and hooked it up to no avail. With the game starting in 5 minutes, they switched us to another suite where the sound worked...and sent us up a bottle of wine ! Despite the weather, the staff of the hotel made our trip successful, and we had a wonderful time. We will definitely return ! CFCOX Oklahoma City, OK

Reviews.Title: “Great For Fleet Week”
Reviews.Author: tomg201
Reviews.Content: Nothing like a great view of the Blue Angels from the rooftop of the Suites. Our room 202 was quite comfortable and the staff members were exceptionally friendly and helpful. We could not have asked for a better stay in San Francisco and look forward to returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “No other place to stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: Frauschmidt3
Reviews.Content: Third stay at the Suites and it was as we remembered. .... in the heart of everything, very comfortable, very clean, we are planning yet another visit.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonFive
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two nights at this hotel. We initially picked this location due to Trip Advisor reports, and l would like to thank all of those who assisted me in that process. You were right. This oasis at Fishermen's Wharf is a travellers dream. We travelled with our Grand Daughter, and it was perfect. A Supermarket is several blocks away, Convenience store within 200 metres, alongside the Hyde Cable Car, 2 blocks from the Fire Engine Ride, just to mention a few. The reception staff were as good as l have ever encountered. Helpful and possibly most important genuine. The rooms were clean, spacious, and the bed was excellent.. Free internet access and airline boarding pass printing was appreciated, as was a little extra coffee when requested. The only downside was that the rooms were not airconditioned, however they are heated. The kitchenette was well stocked, and the view from our suite and the roof was excellent. I will certainly return next visit. For any other Australians, they also honour RACQ, RACV, NRMA etc, as they are associated with AAA. This is indeed a substainial saving.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we chose Suites at Fisherman's Wharf for our stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: keefmeister
Reviews.Content: Extremely reasonable price for amenities and location. This location is just a couple of blocks from the bay. All of Fisherman's Wharf is within walking distance. Resort is right on bus and cable car routes. Beautiful view of the bay from the roof top (2 lounge chairs plus other tables and chairs for relaxing on the roof). We stayed in a one-bedroom suite. Kids slept on a sofa bed. Nice kitchen. TVs in both the bedroom and living room. Staff were very courteous and helpful. If/when we return to San Francisco, we will definitely stay here again. We'll be spreading the word to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: maxxy_10
Reviews.Content: This place was a wonderful location for our 2 days tripping around San Francisco. It was within walking distance of everything and the cable car was right outside. The suite had a full kitchen and lounge which is great for a change from eating out. The TV had 100s of channels. Our room was on the corner and was exceptionally noisy. I had to sleep with earplugs. We had a great time here.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location & views to die for at an affordable rate.”
Reviews.Author: m_smethurst
Reviews.Content: We live in the UK and have visited San Francisco several times before, always staying in hotels around Fisherman's Wharf. We were looking this time for something a little out of the ordinary, since we were going to travel up to North Oregon for a change. Thanks to Trip Advisor we chanced on this apartment block and were not disappointed. We took a taxi from the airport; quick and only $45 right to the door. The staff on reception were extremely helpful and we were shown to our large, clean apartment on the first floor. Although the kitchen only had a two ring electric hob for cooking it was more than adequate for our purposes. If we wanted to cater for ourselves there was a large Safeway a few blocks away (uphill on the way back!)- make sure you register for the Safeway card, since this entitles you to large discounts on a variety of groceries. The roof terrace is well furnished with chairs and tables and provides a stunning view of the whole of the bay. When we were leaving we were due to pick up our Avis hire car and were pleased that most major car rental companies have depots in Fisherman's Wharf, within easy walking distance of the hotel. All in all the hotel was an excellent find and we shall certainly stay there again the next time we visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: DayBob
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed here back in April for a week of vacation. The location of the hotel is perfect. Cable car and bus lines are steps away and the wharf is just a few blocks. Grocery store just down the block. We had a one bedroom suite with a sitting area and kitchen. We asked for a "noisy" room so we could sit on the porch and watch life go by. The bedroom is away from the outside wall so noise wasn't an issue trying to sleep. I can't say anything bad about this hotel. I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with perfect staff”
Reviews.Author: bobbysf3040
Reviews.Content: Having lived in San Francisco for nearly four years, this was the first time I ever visited as a tourist. I cannot say enough about the staff at the Suites of Fishermans Wharf. They go out of their way to make your holiday a perfect one. The location for first time visitors is perfect, since it is steps away from Fisherman's Wharf. Their is good transportation options, both bus and cable car right on the corner to get you anywhere in the city. The suites are large for an urban area and the kitchen is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location, Staff, Facility”
Reviews.Author: Polly33849
Reviews.Content: This is my 10th visit to the Suites. I don't know how they do it (because they were terrific from the very start), but they just keep getting better. Every member of the staff is courteous, attentive (just enough, friendly and not too friendly), and very helpful. A great indication of the spirit of the Suites is that there is very little turnover. Each year, when one returns there, the same super people are there. They are familiar with the entire area so can recommend tours, restaurants, transportation, etc. They can make arrangements if you'd like. They keep up with technology so can even print out boarding passes. The rooms are spotless and if you need anything extra, just phone the front desk - which is manned 24/7. The facility is incredibly convenient to every Fisherman's Wharf location, to shopping, to restaurants. The cable car stops right outside its door. The view from the rooftop garden is breathtaking. We wouldn't stay anywhere else when visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Bike the bridge!!!”
Reviews.Author: Emsiehot
Reviews.Content: This is a superbly well appointed property with clean well equipped apartments, right on the doorstep of the cable car and bus routes and close enough to walk or public transport to just about everywhere. That said the cable car is just outside the door which can be noisy but stops at 12.30pm and starts again at 6.30 am but you get used to this surprisingly quickly. The hotel has washing and drying facilities for clothes by the car garage which are efficent and are $1.50 for a wash and $1.50 to dry. Shopping for food is expensive but if you get a Safeway card as soon as you arrive in the supermarket (on Bay street) you will get discounts on everything and save loads of money. The roof terrace is great for a spot of sun worship and fabulous views fog permitting although you will need summer clothes for the day time and coats scarves and boots for the chilly evenings. Get your self a 3 or 7 day pass just down the hill at the cable car terminus and get around with ease, once you've done the touristy bit on the cable car. The buses and trolley buses are quicker and more frequent although the cable car is a must do down to Union Square experience the thrills of the hills!! Try out the Zuni cafe very good eating out spot. 'Bike the bridge' which you will hear a few hundred times a day is well worth the money we left at 11am from the wharf (just down the hill from the apartment) cycled across the Golden Gate bridge to Sausalito and then onto Tiberon to get the ferry back we arrived back around 19.30 having had a great day and cycling about 20 miles (although the ferry back from Sausalito is also a much less energetic option). Wine tour via the Muir Forest is also worth a trip (leave the kids at home!) plenty of opportunity to sample and buy really good wine and the forest is amazing. The Japanese Tea garden in Golden Gate Park is lovely and free to enter on Monday, Wednesday and Friday between 9 and 10 am. (Get the number 30 bus down to union square and change onto the no 5 to the park). Great trip, great hotel will be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: dshuff11
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting San Francisco this is thee place to stay! The location is perfect for the sightseer. Situated on the corner of Hyde and North Pointe you have access to cable cars, taxis, buses, restaurants, cafes and are within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. The Suites are outstanding and we highly recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RodMiwaukie_OR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved viewing the harbor at night from the roof top, the easy access to the wharf and public transportation, the walks to famous streets and sites, and a full range of eating opportunities from an In and Out Burger to unique waterfront restaurants. This is not a four star hotel, but it's comfortable and homey and we'll be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Always has been a great experience”
Reviews.Author: rsbigroup
Reviews.Content: We are owners of a one bedroom at the Inn at the Opera. When we try and get declined a room at the Inn at the Opera for bonus time we are referred to the Suites at Fishermans Wharf. We have stayed multiple times at the Suites and have enjoyed each stay. Its convenient to all the eateries around fishermans wharf. The rooms are comfortable with newly remodeled living room furniture. The covered parking is a bonus around that area of the wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jonathan62
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting San Francisco with kids you can't beat the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf for location and value. Our suite was clean, roomy and comfortable. The kitchen had everything we needed (including dishwasher) and the living room was remarkably spacious for a hotel in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Can't say enough about this place. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer awareness in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: MRANDMRSFOX1
Reviews.Content: If you intend to stay near Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco be certain to consider the SUITES AT FISHERMAN"S WHARF. It's a small, well kept hotel just a block from the famous Buena Vista cafe. In the other direction is the must see GHIRARDELLI SQUARE...excellent...be sure to get a sundae. Also, it is 4 blocks from Lombard St. and about a half mile to all the shopping at the pier. There is an great view from the rooftop patio. The trolley and cable car lines and buses literally pass right outside the hotel doorway. But best of all was the staff. They are all very attentive to travelers needs. In particular I want to compliment front desk clerk 'Jessica.' She was a customer service expert during our stay. Her attention to detail and customer awareness was unsurpassed.

Reviews.Title: “A stay in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: senorojo
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 days at the Suites second week in July. Third time in the last four years that we have stayed at the Suites and as always it was top notch. The location is the heart of San Francisco with a cable car stop in front of the hotel, fisherman's wharf two blocks south, and Geridalli Square one block west. The 1 bedroom suite was just remodel with a 50 inch flat screen in the living room and balcony with a view of Alcatraz island and the shores of Tiburon in the distance. Service is number 1 with staff very helpfull in providing restuarant recomendations and tourist information. Little Italy is a four block walk and Chinatown about a 20 minute walk. Parking in the city is difficult and expensive strongly recommend a multi-day metro pass that provides use of all buses and cable cars. Saving you much money and headaches. Also recomend going to the dinner theater of Treato ZinZannni at Pier 29.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, fantastic room and unsurpassed service!”
Reviews.Author: Veera25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for just 2 days and nights, but wish it had been longer! San Fran is a great city with so much to see and do, and this is the perfect place from which to do it. The location cannot be beat, the staff was very knowledgeable and helpful with recommendations. The rooms were very spacious, had everything you need, and felt more like apartments than a hotel. The beds were comfy, the place was immaculate. Great value! I would recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “The stay was just too short”
Reviews.Author: Jimmacfly
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel on a hotl.com while searching for a convenient location for a short stay on a road trip from Los Angeles and San Fransisco. And I must say it was a pretty good pick ! The location is really convenient, just beside the Fisherman Wharf with a nice view on it from the roof deck. There's a cable car and a bus stop just in front of the hotel that make the trip to Union Square, lombard street or China town quite easy. If you get a car, there's a parking in the hotel but I must admit it is quite expensive. There is no restaurant but we're talking about suites here and you have a full kitchen in the room. But anyway, the staff is so great that they'll just explain you where everything is located and what you can do. It is probably one of the best services I've seen in a hotel ! If we had knew that the suites were so big, the location so great and the staff so nice ... we would have booked more night, that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent from beginning to end”
Reviews.Author: JBird115
Reviews.Content: The Suites are recently remodeled and what a pleasant and accommodating difference! There is a desk and chair as well as a new sofa with lounger. The upgraded carpeting is appealing. The flat screen TVs are awesome. One can't beat the location - with a cable car stop directly outside the front door as well as bus stops on either corner on a major MUNI line, you don't need a car to enjoy yourself. The staff was helpful and courteous in assisting us with directions, bus info, activities, etc. I can't recommend the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf for the best bargain in town!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, facilities”
Reviews.Author: honuSantaCruz_CA
Reviews.Content: You can't ask for a better location when playing tourist in San Francisco. Although the garage is small, the staff kindly allowed us to leave our car for the whole day. From the hotel, you can walk to Fisherman's Wharf, and public transportation stops outside the door, so you don't need to drive. The facility is small (about 24 suites) but each suite is roomy, with comfortable furniture. Just be warned that the hotel is right near a trolley line and at the corner of two main streets, which means the location is noisy. Staff members were uniformly accommodating, friendly, and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very spacious, i would definately stay there again”
Reviews.Author: suzannecrothers
Reviews.Content: suites at fishermans wharf are a great place to stay to experience the sights and sounds of san francisco. the hotel is in great location with everything you need close at hand. i thoroughly enjoyed my trip and would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations in an ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: tracers60
Reviews.Content: My partner and I wanted a hotel that would allow us to be able to walk to interesting sites while being located along public transportation lines, facilitating exploration of other areas of the city. This place was perfect! We could walk down to the very touristy areas along Fisherman's Wharf or take the trolley or bus, both of which had stops right outside of our hotel, to other areas like Ocean Beach or to an excellent ethiopian restaurant on Geary St. In addition, the rooms were exceptionally clean, and the front desk staff were incredibly helpful and hospitable. The room set up was great; I loved the large glass windows and balcony overlooking North Point and Hyde Streets.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: hotrodforever
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to SF and I had studied this website and read many reviews and decided to stay here. I was so impressed. Jason at the front desk was so polite and helpful and really made us feel welcomed. We arrived a little late and I was worried that we would get the "bottom of the barrel" as far as which rooms were available, and to my suprise we were offered the deluxe suite on the 3rd floor (suite 300) overlooking the bay from the living room and the other side from our bedroom. I had made arrangements for a one bedroom suite however, in the comment section of my reservations I had requested a 2 bedroom if any became available due to the fact that we were bringing our teenage daughter. Well, Jason had read what I wrote and apologized that no cancellations ever came up however, offered us this beautiful upgraded suite. What made it more rewarding is the recent renovations the resort is undergoing. Our room was beautiful and still smelled brand new with new carpeting, tile, paint, furniture, bedding etc... it was our own mini apartment! The pullout sofa bed worked out perfectly for our teenager. She slept very comfortably on this new bed. No complaints! The mini kitchen is adorable, too cute to get dirty! I loved the fact that there was a brochure with suggested grocery markets nearby. I cannot say enough good things about this resort. I highly recommend it. You are truly in the heart of the action and everything was so convenient and in walking distance. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Price, Large Rooms, Good Location, Front Desk Lip Service”
Reviews.Author: RoofDoc
Reviews.Content: First the bad... We were traveling with an infant, so we needed to do laundry. We were at Walgreens and called the front desk, said we were there and did we need to pick up detergent, static sheets and quarters, they said “Nope”, so we asked the same direct question and they repeated they had everything we needed and assured us once more that they had everything. Well, needless to say the same night just 2 hours later, we went to do laundry and the front desk had no detergent and would go check storage. Ten (10) minutes later the guy came back and said they had none. I asked then for quarters and he said sure I will get them and guess what…none! No apologies were made. I explained our earlier phone conversation with someone else and all I got was; just don’t know why we don’t have any of them. No real true care about the situation. I told him to let the manager know and that never happened. I was checking out and the lady asked how our stay was and I said for the most part well and she asked if she could ask what was not good. I started telling her and she kept looking at the phone, when it was not ringing and then when it did she picked it up during the middle of my conversation with her, so I walked off. To this day, we still have not heard from the manager. Secondly the possible indifferent depending on your view… I like soft beds, these beds were hard and largest size was a queen. No view from the room except neighboring buildings. Hallway noise is very easy to hear. Room temperature was a warm, but thank God the windows opened (all but one) and there was a cool breeze. Lastly the good… Roof top view excellent. Location to pier great. Garage parking available ($20/night plus taxes) Large living room and good size kitchen. Overall… Worth the stay, just don't require anything from the front desk, unless it is lip service.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sonia5222010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have never stayed the night in San Francisco before and we are more than glad that we chose the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf. The view from the sun deck was incredible!! And our room was warm and cozy. The Suites was walking distance to the wharf and the grocery store was only four blocks away. We definitely will come back and stay here again and next time spend more the just one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: GwenOnVacation
Reviews.Content: Suites at Fisherman's Warf is a nice hotel close to the cable car stop and with an underground and private garage (not included in room price). Our room had been recently remodeled and everything was nice and new. It was in fact a bedroom, a living room, a kitchen and a bathroom! We didn't have a view over the bay because the room was cheaper that way but it overlooked gardens and nice houses. The service was outstanding. The only minor thing that I would change is the bed mattress which was a bit hard. Excellent stay altogether, I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: orange-u-tall
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf was wonderful. The location right on the Cable Car line and near the bus line was phenomenal. The helpful staff at the relatively small hotel provided excellent, personalized service. Furthermore, the Suites were spacious and well-equipped with a kitchen and dining area. I had no complaints about this hotel, the only mild drawback might have been that it could be a little noisy in the morning, but I have found that in pretty much all hotels in large cities. The hotel also had a nice rooftop terrace to get a nice view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room with a great view and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: dwyerdea
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed with a surprise amenities basket full of delicious treats. The suite was very spacious and comfortable, we could have stayed there for weeks. The view was amazing, we enjoyed the balcony immensely. The staff was very knowledgeable about the surrounding area and offered a great restaurant recommendation, very impressive as we are foodies. The staff was also polite and accommodating. We were also impressed that the parking was complementary, great perk in the city! We plan on staying there again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: bestill46
Reviews.Content: We had not been back to San Francisco in years and our experience at the Suites at Fishermans's Wharf brought this wonderful city back to us in the best possible way. We had an amazing view from our suite. We loved waking up to the sound of cable cars. The location was convenient to everything. The service from everyone at the hotel was outstanding. They provided us with all the information we could ever ask for before we arrived and during our stay in the most friendly manner. The suite was beautifully and meticulously maintained by housekeeping every day. We have stayed at hotels throughout the US and Europe and this delightful place is one of the best!!

Reviews.Title: “The Inn at Fisherman's Wharf is a place to come home to!”
Reviews.Author: Frauschmidt3
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Inn. We were greeted by friendly helpful staff who went out of their way to see that we had everything we needed to enjoy a fabulous stay in the heart of the Fisherman's Wharf. The weather was perfect and we lounged about the green of Ghiradelli Square a short three blocks from our hoteland watched the action.We took in an Opera at the Cowell Theater, also a short and very beautiful walk from our hotel. We ate at Cioppino's where the pasta and seafood dishes are to die for. Next morning we breakfasted at the Buena Vista at the bottom of our hill. We did all this without getting in our car or taking Public Transit.... a treat if you know about parking in SF. Even though we were only 20 miles from home we felt like we were a world away. We came home from our long weekend renewed and recharged. Take a break and vacation where it is all at your door step. We are ready to stay at the Inn at Fisherman's Wharf again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “We would recommend to family and friends”
Reviews.Author: Phillygirl0322
Reviews.Content: we had a 1 bedroom suite and the room was very comfortable and clean The entire staff front desk, housekeeping and maintenance were exceptional. Our first day I left a few glasses in the sink, figuring I would clean them when I returned but housekeeping cleaned them for me. Then the next day I put what we used in the dishwasher and Housekeeping had them put away while we were out. Who else does that for you? The front desk staff answered any and all questions we had about the area with enthusiasm. As well as when we had to check out Jason arranged for a private car to take us to the airport which was no more than the cost of a cab ride. Close to everything especially the cable car which hasa stop right outside.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place with nice people at the desk.”
Reviews.Author: Imagecatcher
Reviews.Content: While it was not super posh, our one bedroom suite perfectly suited our needs. Walking distance to all the activities at Fisherman's Wharf, the cable cars and the street cars made our stay wonderful. The kitchen is tiny but had everything we wanted. Wireless internet in the suites worked very well. I requested a balcony and got one which was a plus. There is a lovely little area on the roof with tables and chairs and a great view. The one bathroom is off the living room rather than the bedroom but for just the two of us that was not a problem. The desk staff were extremely nice and helpful. We will definitely stay there if we can on future trips. We rented a car for two days to tour out of the city and had parking in the garage right under the hotel for a reasonable per night charge of $20.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, clean and comfortable with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: familyfourUk
Reviews.Content: Great for a family lots of room and well equiped kitchen. Really close to the Wharf and all the attractions of San Francisco. On reading reports before we went it said rooms at the front were noisy. We could hear the tram but we could look out over the bay it all added to the San Fran experience. The roof is fantastic for taking up your drinks and watching the sun go down, fantastic view over Alcatraz and the bay. Do cycle over the bridge it was great fun and we caught the ferry back

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Derr9
Reviews.Content: We loved the Suites at FW. It is small, the location is fantastic and the staff is great! We have been there for a week during March for the past two years and would not consider another place in San Francisco. A lot of places charge for services which are included at the SAFW. Loved it. Will return!

Reviews.Title: “Without a doubt, the best place and location to be in San Francisco!!”
Reviews.Author: mariamama
Reviews.Content: From planning at a distance, to booking a shuttle back to the airport, this is the place to go!!!! The staff was not only helpful, but helpful with friendliness, sincerity, and bent over backwards to make this a great stay!!! The housekeeping was impressive, the concierge very detailed and friendly, and the desk manager very insightful, efficient, and also very pleasant!! From start to finish, there is one word for The Suites at Fisherman's Wharf: SUPERB!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Phian
Reviews.Content: This establishment exceeded our expectations by a long way. Without exception the staff were friendly and helpful, I would like to make particular mention of Jason and Jessica who were very knowledgeable. The service was good and the room well furnished and clean. The observation deck on the roof was a nice feature. The next time I need to stay in San Francisco Suites at Fisherman's Wharf will be the first place I will try.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: nola1961
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Suites on Fisherman's Wharf. Was everything we hoped it would be. Checked in at 04:00. I asked the front desk staff if they would offer us a AAA discount. They did with out hesitation. I requested a room that was quiet. We were on the first floor facing the patio. Very quiet room and had no trouble with street noise. The one bedroom unit was large enough for the three of us. Had a nice flat screen tv in the living and bedroom. Bonus dvd player in the living room, too!! The kitchen was adequate; didn't do too much cooking. We walked to the Safeway on North Point. The day before we left, I found that you can order groceries on-line at safeway.com and they will deliver to the hotel for a small fee. The roof top patio was another bonus. We spent an afternoon on the roof top just looking at the surrounding area. You cannot beat this location. One block walk to Ghiradelli, a short walk to Pier 39. Parking was not an issue. They do have limited amount of spots but we counted at least 6 empty spots on the day we arrived. Very easy to get in and out of the garage. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointment and let down”
Reviews.Author: MOWE
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2 bed suite 3 months in advance and had confirmation emails upto and even on the day of arrival. I arrived with a baby and a disabled relative after a 12 hour flight to be told our room had been double booked and the receptionist would have to phone around and try and get us somewhere to stay. The receptionist was clueless and it wasnt until i spoke to the manager that he explained that a refurbishment had run over and caused disruptions in the suites, He did organise a very nice hotel to house us in but it wasn't a suite and therefore all the kitchen appliances were not available (fridge, microwave etc) which was essential for my baby. A very dissappointing experience as i was expecting so much more from all the good reviews. good luck if you reserve a room!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: elainejeanNh
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf. My Husband and I were celebrating our 25th anniversary and we loved every minute of our time in San Fran. The hotel is part of our timeshare and little did we know how fantastic the location of this hotel would be. Transportation is right outside your door and wonderful restaurants and great Irish pubs just around the corner! Fisherman's Wharf is a couple blocks away and so fun. We loved the roof top patio. We hung out there a few times and took in the wonderful views of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate! It was just awesome. Our only complaint would be the rooms are very clean but definatly a little outdated. But, they are remodeling right now so we would love to go back. They were putting in new carpets the week we were there. All and all it was one of our absolutely favorite vacations!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location and a nice view of the bay.”
Reviews.Author: PearlJ30
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night at the Suites during a recent visit to San Francisco. The location is near Ghirardelli Square and walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. Our suite was on the third floor and had a beautiful view overlooking the bay. We also had a small balcony. The suite was clean and nicely furnished with one bedroom (double bed), living/dining room with small table and chairs, a sofa and arm chair, a fully equipped kitchen with silverware, plates, glasses, pots & pans, a two burner stove, large refrigerator and dishwasher. We had a television in the bedroom and in the living room. We found the staff to be courteous, friendly and helpful. We parked our car in the small garage below the hotel. Parking was a little cramped, but we have a small car so wasn’t a problem. We felt the parking cost at $20.00 plus tax per night was reasonable for the convenience. I could hear some street traffic noise during the night (the cable cars run right beside the hotel), but the noise wasn’t disruptive. All in all, my wife and I very much enjoyed our stay and highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at the SF tourist hotspot, fishermans wharf”
Reviews.Author: WildBillFlorida_USA
Reviews.Content: This is a small 3 story apartment style hotel one block from the main street for Fishermans wharf. It has some great views of Alcatraz Prison, and a rooftop plaza, also with great views. It is very convenient to the many activities and amenities at Fishermans wharf; e.g. the Cannery, Giardeli Square, the fresh seafood walk, Seal wharf, etc.. Boats leave for Marin, Alcatraz, AND ALL POINTS ON THE BAY. The staff is tops!! The most helpful that I have encountered in SF. However, there is no restaurant, but the Sutes have a full kitchen, and nearby restaurants offer delivery.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very noisy.”
Reviews.Author: flyofcr
Reviews.Content: Great location. The hotel is walking distance to all attractions. The cable car and street traffic was very noisy making it hard to sleep. We asked to switch rooms the next morning. The front desk was very accomodating. The second room near the back was quiet. The front desk was also very helpful with directions and held our luggage while they were getting our room ready.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: MrSludge
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Suites for a weekend getaway. The staff were great. The room was old, but clean, and surprisingly spacious. FANTASTIC location. Some might be put off by the trolley running outside, since it is kind of noisy, but it's part of the San Francisco experience, isn't it. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value at the Holidays”
Reviews.Author: Ktwofish
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights over the Christmas Holiday in a 2 room suite. The hotel is a little dated, but very clean. The bathrooms definitely need a makeover, but I think they are working on upgrades. We saw them working on another room. The 2 room suite is right on the cable car route side of the hotel, so it is a bit noisy. The cable car runs very late and starts early, so if noise is a problem you won't want a 2 room suite (there are only a few of these and were told they are all on the same side of the hotel). We had an issue with the television, which was not resolved during our stay--it was Christmas. The manager adjusted our bill to make up for the inconvenience. I know--you might be thinking who cares about the TV, but Husband is a big sports fan, so he was not happy about missing some good games. We were there to see our daughter--not so much for sightseeing, so we enjoyed having more room than a typical hotel. It was plenty roomy. One bedroom had a king bed and the other a full size. There was a living/dining room area, and a balcony (overlooking the cable cars). The kitchen was fully equipped with dinnerware, flatware, etc., but there is no oven. There is an oven downstairs, but I had hoped to cook Christmas dinner in our suite. We had to go out for dinner...darn ;-) We were able to make breakfast and other things on the stove top. The dishwasher was extremely loud, so we turned it on when we left. There was a full-size refrigerator, too. The location is excellent for transportation. There was a Walgreen's just a few blocks away, and there is a Safeway grocery a little farther. We bought groceries and rode a bus right back to the hotel. The view from the rooftop is great...wish it was a little warmer so we could have enjoyed it more. The hotel is owned by a timeshare group so be prepared for the pitch to go to their "open house". All in all, it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location .. but right on cable car route..”
Reviews.Author: LGPerth
Reviews.Content: This hotel/apartment was great for our family of 5. The staf were very helpful and the location was great for walking to Fisherman's Wharf. The apartment was basic and reasonably tired and because we were right on the Hyde Street cable car route it was pretty noisy - but this didn't really worry us as we were out most days and too tired to notice when we were in bed! The rates for us - were the best we have had in all our travels around the USA.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't ever want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: californiagirl642
Reviews.Content: What an excellent place, the staff was helpful and very polite, the rooms were spacious, and clean. The parking convient, the neighborhood safe and pretty, and what a view from our balcony. This is a hidden gem, we will be back !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff, best place to stay in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: AZMary
Reviews.Content: Staff was willing to help with anything, great maid service, clean rooms, perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Week Stay--Excellent Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: MelissaofLaMesa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week before traveling out to visit families. We were looking for an inexpensive place to stay that would accomodate our two young children. I would have preferred to stay in a more central location like Union Square but couldn't find anything close to $100/night. This place fit the bill in terms of price and accomodations (it has a pullout bed in the living area). We were very happy with the place. We were allowed to check in two hours early. The crib that we had requested was already set up( it was a nice clean pack 'n play). The space was clean and neat if showing its age in a few places. The only drawback was the noise. We stayed on the second floor on the North Point side. I slept on the pullout bed one night and the street noise was fairly bothersome. It was OK in the bedroom. We had a great time there and were impressed with the great accomodations at a reasonable price. I would pick this place above any other overpriced Fisherman's Wharf hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation at the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf!”
Reviews.Author: AlandSue2
Reviews.Content: The Suites at Fisherman's Wharf provided us a great place to stay, a great location and great staff to help us. Very close to the Wharf, right on the Cable Car and bus routes. With no rental car, we took advantage of the City Pass. The staff were upbeat, friendly and excellent with maps and highlighters to get us where we wanted to go. We loved the balcony to people watch and the rooftop for the great views. The condo was spacious, well appointed and included wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: stevenerc
Reviews.Content: Check it out, stay here! We really enjoyed our trip to San Francisco, so many things to so, places to eat, etc. This location puts it all at your fingertips.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: BlackEyeSusan
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to stay. Right in the hub of everything. Make to sure look at the great scene you get from the roof. Everyone was wonderful and did everything to make our stay a happy one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at The Suites”
Reviews.Author: Burmis
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and daughter recently stayed for 4 nights at The Suites - this was our first introduction to San Francisco and we loved our stay. The 2 bedroom suite with living room and kitchen was spacious and comfortable, the small verandah was marvellous for early morning coffees and the rooftop gave a wonderful view of the bay and alcatraz, during our "happy hour" when we talked to other visitors. The staff were extremely efficient and helpful and free internet access was a bonus....the only tiny drawback was the sound of the trams going by until around 1am - but this was something we were used to after a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a San Francisco Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ldgaff
Reviews.Content: The Suites at Fisherman's Wharf is a great base to operate from. The Hyde Street Cable Car stops at the front door and 4-5 city buses stop at the intersection of Hyde and North Beach(the Suites sits on this corner). Cars are a colossal pain in San Francisco( no parking or very expensive parking) and the bus/streetcar/cable cars are hard to beat + you can buy a 7 day pass good on everything except BART for $28/person. Fisherman's Wharf is an easy 2-3 block walk from the hotel. The hotel has a great staff that is very helpful in everything you might want in the way of info. We stayed in a 2 bedoom unit and everything was very clean,.comfortable, and quiet.. The hotel has a great rooftop deck to enjoy a great view of the Bay and enjoy a nice bottle of fine. If you want a hotel that has an on site restaurant, bar,disco,etc. then this is not the place for you. All those things are close by but not in the hotel. You also get a free newspaper each day as well as free Internet service. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS, FABULOUS, FABULOUS!!”
Reviews.Author: CraddFam09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf for 4 nights with our 2 teenage daughters and it couldn't have been better. The location is amazing, the rooms are incredible and the proximity to transportation, tourist attractions, shopping and restaurants could not be beat. Our Suite was 650sq ft with 1 bedroom, a queen pull-out and a fully equipped kitchen and dining area. We had a balcony with a fabulous view of the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz and an even better view of the entire Wharf area from the roof-top patio where we enjoyed our coffee and breakfast every morning. The staff were very courteous and extremely helpful and met all of our needs recommending places to eat and which attractions to see. The MUNI Cable cars stop right outside the door and is an added bonus that we absolutely loved. I highly recommend this Hotel and will certainly stay again when we return to San Francisco in the future!! The value of location, price and service makes this my #1 place to stay in San Francisco and I looked forward to staying again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: catlady417
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an extended weekend and had two adjacent one bedroom suites, one housing Great Grandma and paternal Grandma, one with maternal Grandma, Mommy and Daddy and 3 year old center of attention. The rooms are spacious, bathroom adequate and sofa sleeper actually not bad to sleep on at all. Since this used to be an apartment complex, the kitchens are great and fully set up for all the items you might require, including salt and pepper. The full size frig let us store some frozen food and milk for the young one. Suites on the Hyde St side (we did not have these) have balconies. If you get one of these be prepared for the sound of the Hyde St cable car which we still heard with windows open on the alley side of the building. The small roof deck will deliver great views of the bay,Oakland Bay Bridge, Alcatraz, and the Golden Gate when the fog lifts so we didn't really miss the balcony. The reception staff are great, the housekeeping staff too and the concierge, Carrie, was patient and informative. She sent us to a great little restaurant on Beach Street (Beach Street Cafe) for breakfast. Food was outstanding, service great, and the 10% off coupon she gave us helpful even though the prices were quite reasonable for San Francisco. As some other reviewers have mentioned, even though the one bedroom suites are supposedly set up for 4 occupants, the dinky dining table had only two chairs. Two more would have really helped. We wanted to get together in one room and play Yahtzee but there was no way to do it without more seating. Another bonus would have been to have the rooms connect. We found these minor items to be the only "if only" type remarks we had the whole weekend.

Reviews.Title: “New but terrific ambience”
Reviews.Author: bababear
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to try Suites at Fisherman's Wharf and we did not expect that inside is so much different from what we have seen from other hotels we've been through. The place is so clean and nice, staff are so helpful, accommodating and their service is fast. Rooms are clean and its just a very different but lovable ambience. Location is very very good too, near fisherman's wharf and cable car is so accessible. You will not regret choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “why stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: lillian35
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 3 night stay in San Francisco (19th July - 22nd July. Why anyone would stay anywhere else is a mystery. We were greeted withh a wonderful welcome. The concierge Sheila showed us some ideas for our stay. The suites are lovely with plenty of space and everything you would need. They are former apartments now used as accommodation. The Hyde & Powell streetcar stop is just outside the front door and you can just jump on board. Pier 39 is about 15 minutes away. When we checked out, reception stored our bags at no charge and helped us into the car with them. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: threat
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant stay at this hotel recently. Stayed in the 2-bdr suite with the balcony view, which was very comfortable for the six of us. Staff was very helpful (Jessie at front desk and also other young lady who's name I forgot (brunette). Location was WONDERFUL -- a block from the Wharf!! Sound was not a problem at all -- close your windows if that trolley bugs you! And the rooftop deck -- SPLEDID. You can see Alcatraz from there! Would definitely recommend this to anyone who'd like a safe and very comfortable stay by the Wharf!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the cost!”
Reviews.Author: kirpow
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights with one young child (4 years old) and chose this bc of the relatively low cost and cheaper parking compared to other hotels near Fisherman's Wharf. Overall very happy. VERY friendly and helpful staff/concierge, good location (able to walk to Pier 39, Ghiradelli, etc), very clean and spacious. Also, free Wifi! The only negative was that it was a little noisy--the street noises, trolley cars, etc could be heard in the living room and the center lounge area could be heard in the bedroom. However, that was minor compared to the numerous positives.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: worldtrippin34
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay. The suite was very roomy and nice, had a great view, great staff, wonderful location. We loved the roof deck, too!

Reviews.Title: “Felt that I lived there”
Reviews.Author: EstamosEnLasPapas
Reviews.Content: I loved the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf. It was wonderful to wake up in the morning to fix our breakfast, sit down with the newspaper that was left outside our door and watch the beautiful view of the Wharf from the breakfast table. There are tables up on the rooftop that offer a full view of the city. Nice for picture taking or relaxing with an afternoon drink. The room was so cozy that we felt we lived there and usually started our day after noon. Location was perfect. We bought a 7 day muni pass at the airport when we arrived. The cable and bus stop was right outside our door. The hotel staff was very knowledgeable about the bus routes and gave us very good suggestions as to what to do and where to eat. Highly recommended feather pillows are available upon request. The only drawback is that due to the date that this hotel was built soundproofing is not good, but the amenities out way this inconvenience. After we had left the hotel we realized that we had left some articles behind. I called the hotel from the airport and was assured that my belongings would be sent by mail. I received them yesterday...Thank you Debbie and Laura. Need I say more...yes I would definitely stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place, we will definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: skikayak
Reviews.Content: When you travel with your young children, it's one thing to know you'll be spending the evening in your hotel rather than going out on the town (unless you hire a babysitter). It's another to have to share the same small hotel room with them. The Suites at Fisherman's Wharf was the ultimate solution to this situation - at a great value. We had a great time exploring San Francisco, a fun dinner out (Las Margaritas), then came back to our suite and put our daughter to bed in the other room while we were able to stay up longer to enjoy the rest of the evening in the rest of the unit without disturbing her. In addition, we found the room very well appointed with decent furnishings and decor, coffee, coffee filters as well as all the expected amenities. The unit was clean, quiet, spacious and comfortable. We chose to not go with the "deluxe" one bedroom (meaning we would have a balcony and view of the wharf), and instead had a quieter unit facing residential units. Having access to the awesome rooftop deck more than made up for this. The location was perfect - Fisherman's Wharf, cable car, North Beach all within walking distance. The staff was great and the parking reasonable for the area. Oh - try Pat's Cafe for breakfast - absolutely delicious and outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Gorgeous room”
Reviews.Author: jodmendez
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Suites at Fisherman’s Wharf. This complex is a former apartment unit and is very spacious. We were able to check in early and arrived in our room that was gorgeous. We had four huge windows overlooking the city and a full kitchen, living room and bedroom. The suites offered a very nice and clean place for a family to stay. Once you step outside your door you are within blocks of the Fisherman’s Wharf and the trolley picks up and drops off right out front. http://www.joreviews.com/travel/valentines-day-san-francisco-ca

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: eads
Reviews.Content: Our experience as a family at the Suites, was nothing short or fantastic. The property is very clean, atmosphere very pleasant, location fantastic, and overall experience wonderful. Thanks to all the staff for such a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “So-so stay there.”
Reviews.Author: PapaWestCoast
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 204 for one night. The front desk clerks were very helpful with check in and check out. However, I was surprised that I would have to pay an extra $20 for parking. This was not noted on the website or reservation. The conciere(older asian man) was rude. As soon as we walked into the lobby, instead of asking, he told my guest and I that he needed to talk to us in such a tone that we thought was rude and demanding, hhhmmm...no, rather it's if I want to talk to u or need ur services I will, but to tell me u need to talk to me, especially if ur suppose to be a conciere and we hadn't even checked in yet.......well no. Fortunately, I saw it this morning while getting ready to leave the hotel, but under the coffee table there were cut toe nail trimmings from someone who had stayed there. It tells me that the cleaning lady was lazy and didn't vaccum under the coffee table, which is unacceptable. Makes one wonder what else wasn't clean, hhmmm? Also, while using the hair dryer the fuse blew so it shut the power off to the entire unit except the refrigerator. I had to test the GFI and fuse box to finally trigger the power back on. There's a reasonable expectation that someone will use the hair dryer so why not upgrade the fusebox to accomodate the power surge?! In todays times, this should not be happening. As for the room itself, I realze they're old and for the most part the room was fine. I do like the idea of having a kitchen and separate bedroom/living room so if someone wants to nap or sleep they can without it bothering anyone. U don't find these types of places much. The roof top wharf view is nice and it's close to areas of interest that walking to and from makes it easy instead of driving everywhere. Value wise, it's very affordable for what ur getting, which is why I gave it a 5 star. As far as recommending it, well, not so sure. Perhaps if ur doing a quick overnighter and don't care about quality, service,etc...but if I'd recommend it to my parents for them to stay, no I wouldn't because of the items mentioned. It's the little things that matter and rudeness before u check in, power going out because of a hair dryer and toe nail clippings.....I'll look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: elllpeee
Reviews.Content: Every staff member we encountered was extremely friendly and helpful, and this set the facility apart from others. The location was perfect, 1 block from Ghirardeli Square and the Hyde Street Cable Car and 2 blocks from the waterfront. The room itself was slightly dated, but was not lacking. The bathroom was a little cramped, but all in all, the room was comfortable. The interior courtyard provides a pleasant place to sit and meet with others and the rooftop patio is very nice, if the weather cooperates. The patio does provide a perfect view of the bay and Alcatraz. The kitchenette and living room were nice, but we did not take advantage as we were there for only 1 night. Would highly recommend for a longer stay and will definitely look at this property again if we are staying in the city. Parking is very limited, as it is everywhere in San Francisco. Overnight parking fee of $20 is quite reasonable compared to other locations, but the enclosed structure has only a few spaces and is very tight. With public transportation close by, a car is more hassle than it is worth.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service & Incredible location”
Reviews.Author: howlandj
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff-very friendly & helpful!! Great location. Trolley right out front door. Bike rental & car rental close. Roof top tables and chairs provide a wonderful view of the bay. The location and the wonderful staff make this a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “shell vacations has never let me down”
Reviews.Author: ESF9FA
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I stayed in a one bedroom condo. The location is walking distance to Ghiradelli Sqare and Fishermans Wharf. It is very convenient for taking public transportation--we took the trolleys, cable cars and buses everywhere we went. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The unit was very spacious and comfortable. even the bed in the pull out couch was pretty comfy! It did get a little stuffy in the unit while we were gone during the day, but it cooled down quickly once we opened the windows. (we didn't want to leave them open while we were gone since we were on the 1st floor) I own timeshare with Shell Vacations and used points for our stay, so I'm not sure what the pricing is like if you have to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Undiscovered Gem”
Reviews.Author: Dasani_9
Reviews.Content: I was in town for three days conducting meeting to hire a salesperson. The room was ideal for this purpose. The view awesome! I would like to commend the front desk staff on how effecient they were in routing people to and from the meeting suite I will definately use this property again for business or pleasure!! Thanks Again!

Reviews.Title: “What a GREAT place!!!”
Reviews.Author: PhattGirl
Reviews.Content: GREAT location (3 blocks from the water)! GREAT rooftop view (Alcatraz, Bay & G.G. Bridges)! GREAT room! Close to everything, with the most helpful staff ever (Jessica).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise - Nice place, Great value!”
Reviews.Author: nevada007
Reviews.Content: We visited for three days with our two kids. The hotel rates were competitive to other standard rooms in the motels/hotels in the area, but the rooms were suites (much better value) and the parking was half the price of the other hotels (be sure if you're looking for a hotel in Fisherman's Wharf to ask about the parking price - some hotels charge an additional $50 per night over and above the room rate - the parking here was $20 per night, and was secured & covered - in the basement of the building). We stayed in a one bedroom suite, with living room, kitchen & bathroom. The Living room had a Queen-sized sleeper sofa. Bedroom and living room had a TV with a dvd/vcr in the livingroom. Kitchen included a full size refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker (with complimentary coffee) , dishes and dishwasher. The bed was comfortable and rooms was clean. This hotel exceeded our expectations, and we'll definitely try to stay here again when we visit next time. This hotel is part time-share, part hotel (we didn't have to sit through a sales pitch if you're wondering), and is well maintained, conveniently located next to several bus routes and the Hyde street trolly - ((Check into getting a city pass when you're there - but if you plan on going to to Alcatraz, buy the City Pass from the Alcatraz booth on Pier 33. The Pass gives you 7 days unlimited use of the muni bus, cable cars and trolly's, gets you into Alcatraz, the California Acadamy of Science, the Exploratorium, Yerba Buena Gardens, the Aquarium, plus discounts on other attractions. You save about 50% off the entry into those attractions, plus get the value of the bus lines!)) Anyway, back to the hotel, there is a viewing area on the roof which is great for pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: danthemanpurdue
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a little worn but the staff makes up for it with very friendly service. Everyone went out of their way to be helpful. The location is great and we enjoyed using the public transportation system to get around. The Japanese Tea Garden in Golden Gate Park is just beautiful! I really enjoyed Muir Woods also. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, good location, good staff”
Reviews.Author: NickE2
Reviews.Content: This three night stay gave us a comfortable starting point for exploring San Francisco. A nice quiet neighborhood with Fishermann's Wharf nearby. Staff was very helpful with suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “awsome!”
Reviews.Author: itsme376
Reviews.Content: best location n awsome rooms with a cute well equiped kitchen ..very spacious and d communication from dr to newhere in san francisco is awsome!! we had a lovely time! for grocery safeway department store was d closest and they had nearly eveything u wnt!..d cable cars go ryt in front o the hotel..overall it was one of the most wonderful holidays i ever had.. d only negative thing about these suites would be the internet access....holy slow!!!! but thn it hrdly weighs nething in front of d good thigns of this hotel,,.,very warm n welcoming staff./.....walking distance to ghiradelli square n many eating places and pier 39.....r balcony faced d ocean n d view was breathtaking!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Almost Every Way”
Reviews.Author: Elkbow
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful home-away-from-home! The staff was exceptionally helpful and warm. The 1-bedroom suite made our time in San Francisco especially easy, since my husband will not eat out, and we had to return for him to fix his lunch as well as dinner. Our room did not face the street, so it was quite quiet -- except for when our next-door neighbors left at 4 a.m. one morning and spoke loudly as they were moving their luggage out. But, that was something that could happen anywhere. For us, there was nothing more we could have wanted from our accommodations. Special kudos to Sunday afternoon's desk clerk and concierge!

HotelInfo.Name: Suites at Fisherman's Wharf
HotelInfo.Address: 2655 Hyde Street, San Francisco, CA 94109-1249
